7:42.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At bet365 Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Dancingwithmyself
runners.comment: Suggested she was worth another go over further when beaten a neck at Kempton last month
runners.spotlight: Three wins, including one here (1m), as a 2yo; never figured at Goodwood (1m4f, good) 13 days ago but had previously gone down by just a neck at Kempton (1m4f, Polytrack), shaping as though worth another go over a longer trip; respected.

runners.name: Clockmaker
runners.comment: Got the better of a subsequent winner at Doncaster last month; a player on Polytrack debut
runners.spotlight: Made it seventh-time lucky when just getting  the better of a subsequent winner on his return from five months off at Doncaster (14.5f, good to firm) 19 days ago; only 2lb higher and a player on Polytrack debut.

stable_tour.quote: He's a frustrating horse. He would not go around the bend at Goodwood last time out. He's so straightforward at home but it's like something switches when he goes to the racecourse. He becomes tricky but he's a talented horse who wants to stay and that's his game. I'll probably keep him busy this autumn and get him racing regularly to teach him how to race. I think a mile and a half is ideal and as long as there are no extremes in the ground I think he'll be fine anywhere in the middle. 04-09-24

runners.name: Maxident
runners.comment: Something to prove on AW debut after eight months off; market informative
runners.spotlight: 0-10 since his successful racecourse debut and something to prove on AW debut after eight months off, albeit he has run well fresh in the past; market informative.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice type of horse and loves soft ground. He got struck into earlier on in the season and we weren't able to run him for a while and then we were waiting for the ground. He ran as well as his handicap mark would allow the other day and it was a very hot race at Hamilton. I think he's off a reasonable mark and if we get some rain in the autumn I think he'll win a decent race before the end of the season. 21-09-23

runners.name: Sax Appeal
runners.breeder: C&s B/S Ltd, C Younghusband, K McGivern
runners.comment: Back off the same mark as when completing a hat-trick at the start of the year
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who hasn't been at his best in his last four outings, but is back off the same mark as when completing a hat-trick over 1m4f on Tapeta at the start of the year; has run well over C&D and he could enjoy the run of the race.

runners.name: Kingdom Of Stars

prev_owners.owner: M White, Mrs A Gillies And Partner

runners.comment: Ran well in two Kempton handicaps last month but not sure a drop in trip is what he needs
runners.spotlight: 0-5 but has improved since returning in 2m handicaps on the Kempton Polytrack last month; 2lb well in after his narrow defeat there eight days ago, but not entirely sure the drop in trip in a small field is what he needs.

7:07.race_name: bet365 EBF 'Confined' Fillies' Novice Stakes (Fillies, Have Run No More 2 Times) (GBB/GBBPlus)

runners.name: Lair De Panache
runners.owner: L Sangster, J Chapple-Hyam & A Harrison
runners.comment: Well-beaten last of five on Kempton debut last September; has enough to prove; hood on
runners.spotlight: Nice pedigree, but finished a well-beaten last of five on her Kempton debut (1m, Polytrack) last September; bred to appreciate the longer trip and a hood is given a go, but she still has enough to prove against the 3yos.

runners.name: Cape Flora
runners.comment: Possible to make excuses for both starts; well bred so could take a big step forward
runners.spotlight: 260,000gns yearling; well held in both outings though it's possible to make excuses for both, as when breaking very awkwardly on last month's Ascot return (1m2f, good to firm; first-time hood); beautifully bred so could take a big step forward at any time.

runners.name: Catherines Gift

prev_owners.owner: Mohamed Jaber Alharbi & Rabbah Bloodstock Ltd

runners.comment: Showed ability in one start in France last November; shortlisted on stable debut/return
runners.spotlight: Showed ability when fourth of ten on her debut in a Chantilly maiden (9.5f, Polytrack) last November (winner has since won a Group 3 and finished third in the French 1000 Guineas); makes her stable debut (same owner) after seven months off; shortlisted.

runners.name: Danza Parigina
runners.comment: Caught the eye when fifth on debut here a fortnight ago; should stay this far; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Sent off 14-1 and caught the eye when a keeping-on fifth of 12 behind a stablemate on her debut here (1m) a fortnight ago; shouldn't have a problem with the longer trip and respected.

runners.name: Jeanne Baret
runners.comment: Some ability when third of five on Pontefract debut but will need to improve to take this
runners.spotlight: 13-2 and hinted at ability when third of five behind a 1-12 shot on her Pontefract debut (1m2f, good) in April; half-sister to seven winners (a couple of them useful) but she will need to improve to take this.

runners.name: Little Chanter
runners.comment: Well beaten on her debut here in December; major improvement required; tongue-tie on
runners.spotlight: 66-1 when eighth of ten on her debut here (6f) in December; this trip more in line with her pedigree and a tongue-tie is given a go, but major improvement is required.

runners.name: Sea The Wonder
runners.comment: Refused to enter the stalls on her intended debut at York last month (9-2 at the time)
runners.spotlight: 310,000gns yearling; dam unplaced 6.5f/1m in France (RPR 70), closely related to multiple 1m4f-2m Group 2 winner Enbihaar, half-sister to useful winners Silent Attack (7f-1m) and King Bolete (1m-1m4f); enough to like on pedigree and worth a market check; refused to enter the stalls on her intended debut in a Class 2 York novice last month (9-2 at the time).

runners.name: Soldiers Chorus
runners.owner: Tars Farm, D Salabi & Guy Pariente Hold
runners.comment: Sire 17-58 (29%) here in past five seasons but stable not noted for winning newcomers
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to German 1m2f winner Sayulita; dam French 1m winner, half-sister to winners Salve Venezia (German 1m2f Listed) and Sun Of Gold (French 1m6f Listed), is granddaughter of German Oaks winner; sire 17-58 (29%) here in past five seasons, but stable not noted for winning newcomers.

runners.name: Treasured Angel
runners.breeder: Kirtlington Park, A Davis & E Foster
runners.comment: Showed some ability on her Newmarket debut but longer trip not sure to suit on pedigree
runners.spotlight: Surrounded by subsequent winners when a keeping-on fourth of seven on her Newmarket debut (1m, good to soft; 80-1) in April; was still beaten 10l by the winner, though, and the longer trip isn't sure to suit on pedigree.

runners.name: Notimeforchitchat
runners.comment: Flopped badly over C&D last time but won over 7f previously; still unexposed at this trip
runners.spotlight: Ran as though something was amiss over C&D in April but made a winning seasonal debut at Kempton (7f) in March and remains very unexposed over this trip; can be dangerous if back on song.

stable_tour.quote: He won really well over a mile at Kempton last time on his second run. He's a big horse, probably 16.1hh, and shouldn't have been able to win as a two-year-old. He's a big, weak horse, but he was very impressive when he won. He's exciting going forward. 18-09-24

runners.name: Enrolled
runners.comment: 0-7 now but ran well when fourth at Goodwood last month and Polytrack also suits
runners.spotlight: More exposed than some of these but sound effort when fourth in slightly higher-grade race at Goodwood (1m, good) last month and will be suited by this return to Polytrack; won't be far away if stamina holds out over this new trip.

runners.name: Yuvraaj
runners.comment: Returned from unsuccessful stint in UAE with 1m Kempton AW win last month; still unexposed
runners.spotlight: Returned from very unsuccessful two-race dirt campaign in UAE with 20-1 win on handicap debut at Kempton (1m, AW) last month; remains lightly raced and could easily have more to offer over 1m2f.

runners.name: Aqab
runners.comment: Displayed significant promise in all three qualifying races; up in trip for handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Displayed significant promise in all three qualifying races, most recently when sixth of 15 in good 1m maiden here a fortnight ago; upped in trip for this handicap debut; no surprise if he features.

runners.name: Riyadh Gem
runners.comment: 2-2 in AW handicaps; ran well on recent turf debut and might still be on the upgrade
runners.spotlight: Scored on nursery debut at Southwell (1m) in November and followed up on reappearance at Wolverhampton (8.6f) in April; kept on for very respectable third when upped to 11.4f for recent turf debut and could still have untapped potential over middle-distance trips back on the AW; sports first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Hot Dancer
runners.breeder: Minster Stud And Mrs H Dalgety
runners.comment: Twice made the frame at about 1m last month; moves up in trip here; a possible
runners.spotlight: Made the frame on both appearances since his underwhelming seasonal/handicap debut in April; needs to find something extra to open his account today but the move up from about 1m may unlock some improvement.

runners.name: Word Of Mouth
runners.comment: Both 1m AW this spring were encouraging; up in trip for h'cap debut; improvement possible
runners.spotlight: Made low-key debut on soft going in the autumn but both AW runs this spring were much more encouraging; moves up from 1m today; should have some improvement to come on handicaps.

runners.name: The Hrse Horse
runners.comment: Went very close on recent handicap debut, despite losing ground by racing wide; respected
runners.spotlight: Went very close when upped to 1m for recent handicap debut at Windsor (1m, good to firm) despite losing ground by hanging left and racing wide around the first two bends; moves up in trip again before 1lb nudge takes effect and will be fine back on Polytrack; needs to be taken very seriously.

runners.name: American Treasure
runners.comment: Some ability in second of three AW novices, but this looks a tough ask on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Best of three starts in AW novices when fourth of nine (under Rossa Ryan) at Southwell (6f, Tapeta) in April, but well held at Kempton (7f, Polytrack) three weeks ago; still open to improvement but this looks a tough ask on handicap debut.

runners.name: Hilltop
runners.comment: Hasn't been seen in almost a year; market should be informative
runners.spotlight: Twice made the frame at Wolverhampton (6f/8.6f) in 2024 before two modest efforts on turf; return to AW may help but she hasn't been seen in almost a year; market should be informative.

runners.name: Stella Hogan
runners.comment: C&D winner who is 2lb well in after her recent Kempton success; major player
runners.spotlight: Three wins on Polytrack this year, including in a first-time eyeshield over C&D in March; broke better than she had been when successful in returning cheekpieces under Mason Paetel at Kempton (1m) eight days ago, probably hitting the front soon enough; avoids a penalty for that and 2lb well in; major player.

runners.name: Moostar
runners.comment: Half-sister to a multiple AW winner but not guaranteed to improve for the longer trip
runners.spotlight: Made a successful nursery debut when making all at Thirsk (6f, good to soft) last September and didn't run badly when in midfield on her Windsor return (6f, good to firm) in April; half-sister to a multiple AW winner but not guaranteed to improve for the longer trip.

quotes.race: Up To £25 Back With Bresbet Nursery Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Moostar was pretty good today. Speaking to Daryll [Holland, trainer] beforehand, he just said she is more of a galloper than a filly who quickens so I made use of that stride. She's still learning. I felt she wasn't doing a tap in front once I asked her a question and hopefully there's plenty more to come - Jason Watson, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: The New Bay Pearl
runners.comment: Placed in her last three appearances on the AW but the return to 7f may not be ideal
runners.spotlight: Placed in her last three appearances on the AW, as when third of ten at Kempton (1m, Polytrack) last month; given how well she finished her race off there the return to 7f may not be ideal, though.

runners.name: Ornately
runners.comment: Best efforts have come at Wolverhampton but still shortlisted back on Polytrack
runners.spotlight: Made a successful handicap debut at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) in February and beaten just a neck over the same C&D a fortnight ago; up 1lb but still shortlisted if as effective back on Polytrack; stable also runs Rift Valley.

quotes.race: BetMGM: It's Showtime Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: We were quite clear we wanted to get cover on Ornately and it worked out quite nicely. She settled well and David Evans's horse [Piranha Rama] dragged us all the way to the furlong pole. She's done it well - Daniel Muscutt, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Elizabeth Bay
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs B V Sangster & J Chapple-Hyam
runners.comment: Beaten a total of two rivals in three starts since returning in March; enough to prove
runners.spotlight: Showed ability in both starts on turf last year, but has beaten a total of two rivals in three starts over 7f on turf/Polyrack since returning in March (handicap debut last time); down another 3lb but has enough to prove for now.

runners.name: Maids Head
runners.comment: In the frame in seven of her nine starts; return to this trip should suit; each-way claims
runners.spotlight: In the frame in seven of her nine starts, as when beaten a length into fourth of eight at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta; first-time cheekpieces) last month (runner-up has won since); return to this trip should suit and, despite her wide draw, she holds each-way claims again.

runners.name: Windsor Pass
runners.comment: Consistent; no surprise if she goes well again, but is 1-36; others preferred for the win
runners.spotlight: No doubting her consistency and she remains just 1lb higher than when winning over C&D in January; no surprise if she goes well again despite her wide draw, but given her record of 1-36 others are preferred for the win.

runners.name: Florida Dawn
runners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan Bin Mohammed Al Maktoum
runners.comment: Well beaten since winning a slowly run Newcastle novice; plenty to find; blinkers on
runners.spotlight: Made all in a slowly run four-runner Newcastle novice (7f, Tapeta) in February, but her three efforts since, including heavy defeats in her last two outings, suggest she has plenty to find; another 3lb drop and the fitting of blinkers has to make a big difference.

runners.name: Princess Pw
runners.owner: Penny Wotherspoon Gay Kelleway Ben Crew

prev_owners.owner: Miss P Wothersoon, Michael Watt, B Crew
Miss P Wotherspoon & Michael H Watt

runners.comment: In the frame in her first six starts and not beaten far last time; still needs more
runners.spotlight: In the frame in her first six outings (including over C&D) and not beaten far into sixth of 12 at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta) last month, where meeting early trouble and dropping in trip conspired against her; still needs more to get off the mark, though.

runners.name: Sunshine Soul
runners.comment: Showed promise in her first few starts, but hasn't built on it; opposable upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in her first few starts over sprint trips on turf/Tapeta, but she hasn't built on it despite a plummeting mark and an experiment with headgear; dam's side of pedigree suggests the step up in trip may suit, but drawn widest and needs a resurgence.

runners.name: Rift Valley
runners.comment: Took a step backwards when last of eight at Wolverhampton last time; up in trip; hood on
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in her next four starts after her debut, but last of eight at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta) last month (Maids Head fourth); up a furlong and tongue-tie worn last time replaced by first-time hood, but Ornately looks the stable's main hope.

5:00.race_name: bet365 EBF Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Band D) (EBF Qualifier) (GBB/IRE Incentive) (Div I)

runners.name: Athenas Fortune
runners.owner: J W Parry And Mrs C Shekells
runners.comment: 40-1 when sixth of 11, beaten 14l, on Newmarket debut;  needs more in the added hood
runners.spotlight: Went off at 40-1 on Newmarket debut (6f, good) when sixth of 11, beaten 14l, three weeks ago; 22-1 when withdrawn for her intended AW debut here on Sunday (got loose before the start); now hooded.

runners.name: Availability
runners.comment: 5,000euros yearling; April foal by Supremacy; market can guide on this debut
runners.spotlight: 5,000euros yearling; April foal; Supremacy half-sister to five winners including Master Matt (5f-7f including AW/Listed; RPR 109), Kuwait City (5f including 2yo; 88) and Himmah (US 6f AW); dam 6f AW winner (86); market can guide on debut.

runners.name: Due Destiny
runners.comment: Due Diligence filly related to 2yo winners; one of the more likely debutantes
runners.spotlight: March foal; Due Diligence half-sister to 5f/6f winner Stormy Pearl (including 2yo; RPR 72); dam 6f winner (83), half-sister to Listed-placed 5f 2yo winner Strange Magic, out of 6f 2yo winner; yard is 2-31 with juveniles this year; speedy pedigree and one of the more likely debutantes.

runners.name: Eclipser
runners.comment: Good debut when fourth at Windsor 17 days ago; related to AW winners; sets the standard
runners.spotlight: April foal; 11,000euros yearling; 40-1, promising debut when fourth of 12, beaten just over 2l, at Windsor (6f, good to firm; seventh has won since) 17 days ago; that bare form already sets a clear standard and she's related to some smart sorts on AW so likely there's more to come on this surface.

runners.name: Gaia Tina
runners.comment: February foal; 44,000euros yearling; by Ghaiyyath; classy pedigree; market helpful
runners.spotlight: February foal; 44,000euros yearling; Ghaiyyath half-sister to winners Ermesinde (Listed-placed 1m2f AW; RPR 102) and Sonic Blue (5f 2yo; 74); dam unraced half-sister to German Group 2 winners Eagle Rise (1m) and Eye Of The Tiger (1m4f); classy pedigree and the market can guide on her introduction.

runners.name: Houdini Miss
runners.comment: £5,000 yearling by Starman; dam won at two; yard had a couple of 2yos run well this year
runners.spotlight: March foal; £5,000 yearling; by Starman, who's firmly off the mark with his first-crop 2yos; dam 7f 2yo winner (RPR 70), closely related to dual 7.4f Group 3 winner Tested, half-sister to useful 1m2f/1m6f winner Track Record; yard 0-5 with juveniles this year but a couple have run well.

runners.name: Jane Of The Jungle
runners.comment: 22-1 when fifth of eight at Brighton nine days ago; drawn widest for this AW debut
runners.spotlight: 22-1 when fifth of eight, beaten nearly 7l, at Brighton (6f, good) on her introduction nine days ago; open to improvement but that form puts her a notch or two below Eclipser; drawn widest for this AW debut.

runners.name: Miss Mambo
runners.comment: 10,000euros yearling by Elzaam; Rossa Ryan 3-13 for the yard; watch the market
runners.spotlight: April foal; 10,000euros yearling; by Elzaam; winning siblings include Beattie Is Back (7f AW; RPR 88), Raintown (1m-1m4f AW including 2yo; 84) and No Thanks (11.6f-2m1f Flat, 84; 2m3f/2m7f hurdle); dam placed 4.5f-1m in France (including in 7f Group 3; 103); Rossa Ryan, 3-13 for the yard, is an interesting booking; watch the market.

runners.name: No Way Hozay
runners.comment: £9,000 breeze-up 2yo by No Nay Never; hooded for her debut
runners.spotlight: 35,000gns yearling; £9,000 breeze-up 2yo; by No Nay Never; sixth foal; dam unraced half-sister to 1m Group 1 winner Lillie Langtry (dam of Oaks winners Tuesday and Minding) and 1m2f Listed winner Count Of Limonade; yard is 0-4 with its juveniles this year; hooded for debut.

runners.name: Out In The Cold
runners.breeder: C N Wright, M Bell & A Elliott
runners.owner: C Wright, D Kilburn And Partners
runners.comment: Debutante by Elzaam; yard is 2-14 with its juveniles this year (one on debut)
runners.spotlight: February foal; by Elzaam; third foal; half-sister to 5f winner Ginormous (RPR 64); unraced dam closely related to 7f Group 2 winner Happy Power and 7f/1m winner Melody Of Life, out of unraced half-sister to 7f 2yo Group 2 winner Cairns; yard is 2-14 with its juveniles this year (one on debut).

runners.name: Spirit Star
runners.comment: Ran on to take modest fourth at Wolverhampton (5f) 24 days ago; draw not helpful
runners.spotlight: Outpaced in early stages before running on to take modest fourth at Wolverhampton (5f, Tapeta) 24 days ago; needs more but she ought to be more streetwise this time and the extra furlong is a likely plus; draw not helpful, though.

runners.name: Sunshine And Roses
runners.comment: January foal by Massaat; market should guide ahead of this debut
runners.spotlight: January foal; by Massaat; second foal; dam prolific 1m-13.3f winner (mainly AW; RPR 77), sister to prolific 1m-2m winner Precision Strike, half-sister to 5f/6f winner Under Approval, out of unraced half-sister to 5f/6f 2yo Group 2 winner Winker Watson; market can guide.

6:05.race_name: It's Never Ordinary At bet365 Handicap

runners.name: Miss Applejack
runners.comment: Good third on handicap debut (1m4f), her last start on the Flat; more to come at this trip
runners.spotlight: Pulled up over fences latest; good start to her Flat career when second in an admittedly weak novice (9.5f) in January and it was her best run when third on handicap debut (also Wolverhampton, 1m4f) having been ridden prominently; new trip could eke out a bit more.

runners.name: Sullivan Bay

prev_owners.owner: L J Williams & J D Packer Syndicate

runners.comment: C&D winner; respectable third here (2m) 14 days ago came after a break; player
runners.spotlight: In good form on the AW (visored) for his new stable in the autumn/winter, winning over C&D on first occasion and placed in next three runs (1m6f-2m); had wind surgery (his second) before a respectable third here (2m; blinkers, retained) a fortnight ago; can probably build on that first start in 88 days.

runners.name: Star Delta
runners.comment: Good effort two starts back when second (1m4f); moderate latest; up in trip again
runners.spotlight: Fair effort on his only AW start (9.5f); bred to be a sprinter but he's finding stamina from somewhere and recorded just about his best effort upped to 1m4f when second at Catterick (good to firm) two starts back; not so good over that trip at Beverley (good) next time, though, and he's got a bit to prove up in distance again.

runners.name: Smokey Malone
runners.comment: In good form and won over C&D last time; will likely give it his best shot again
runners.spotlight: Runner-up to Zooks over 1m5.5f here on penultimate run and continued his good spell on AW by scoring narrowly over C&D (not clear run, led final strides) last time; that was his second win in his last four starts and he's gone up only 3lb in total; likely goes well again.

quotes.race: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Classified Stakes (Div II)
quotes.quote: I'm absolutely thrilled, it's really nice to get the monkey off our backs. We've only been going from the 1st of January and we haven't had much to run. We weren't really expecting much tonight but what a legend Smokey Malone is, he always gets us out of trouble and he's Dylan's [Hogan, jockey] favourite horse as well - Shelley Birkett, joint-trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Zooks
runners.comment: Consistent form since winning here in February; sure to be on the premises again
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 20th attempt when winning over 1m5.5f here (Smokey Malone second) in February and has run almost to the pound in four starts since, including when third on turf (2m) last time; on the premises again.

runners.name: New York Bay
runners.owner: Paul F Arun R Keith C

prev_owners.owner: Matthew S Paul F Arun R Keith C
Matthew S Paul F Arun R Keith C & Gay K

runners.comment: Won twice around this trip last January; off for 466 days before a fair return latest
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced but he won his second and third handicaps, around 1m6f at Wolverhampton and Chelmsford last January; beaten just over 9l on comeback at Wolverhampton (about 2m) last month but he went through the race encouragingly; that was his first start for 466 days and he's entitled to be sharper this time.

stable_tour.quote: I like him very much. He won two races at around 1m6f at Wolverhampton and Chelmsford in January but since February he's had a holiday. He's always been a backward horse. I think he's probably one of my best-handicapped horses- thank God! He's only going to improve and get stronger as he gets older. He's a big horse and will probably end up jumping in due course. 08-05-24

runners.name: Prince Abu
runners.comment: Hasn't won since 2022; off 322 days; market check for yard debut after 3,400gns sale
runners.spotlight: Four-time Flat winner in low-grade AW handicaps (1m6f-2m, three in a hood) but the last of them was in late 2022 and there's been a steady decline since; pulled hard when well held over hurdles last July on latest outing; left Derek Shaw for 3,400gns in January; returning hood makes its first appearance for well over two years and he's worth a market check on this stable debut.

runners.name: Adelaide Bay
runners.owner: Mrs B V Sangster & Jane Chapple Hyam
runners.comment: Made it 2-3 this year when 7f winner at Wolverhampton in May; up 3lb; more to come
runners.spotlight: Just over 1l behind City Captain over C&D when they made their handicap debuts in September but time has moved on since and he made it two wins from three starts in 2025 when giving weight to a subsequent winner at Wolverhampton (7f) last month; up another 3lb; still going the right way.

runners.name: Dr Ali
runners.comment: 0-10; has been running well at 6f/7f on AW for new yard but continues vulnerable
runners.spotlight: 0-10; has been running well at 6f and 7f on AW for new yard but hard to call him well treated even though he's slipped a few pounds; vulnerable.

runners.name: Sharp Call
runners.comment: Minor form so far and she finished nearly 9l behind Adelaide Bay on handicap debut (7f)
runners.spotlight: Caught the eye of the stewards in one qualifying run, over 7f on Southwell AW in February, but she hasn't achieved a lot since and was nearly 9l behind Adelaide Bay on handicap debut at Wolverhampton (7f; 40-1) last month; needs major turnaround.

runners.name: Kodi Banphrionsa
runners.comment: Has useful siblings at 5f-7f; not yet a threat but this is a more suitable level
runners.spotlight: Dam bred some useful performers at 5f-7f, including on AW; has not yet threatened in 5f and 7f events at Newmarket and Doncaster but the latter effort was quite promising and this is a more suitable level.

runners.name: Arlecchinos Rex
runners.comment: Winning handicap debut (7f, AW) but it's not been easy in this grade of late; tongue tied
runners.spotlight: Wide-margin winner of handicap debut at Wolverhampton (7f, AW) in November but it's not been easy in this grade since running well in a higher one at Kempton (7f) in January; needs new tongue-tie to help if he's to overcome in-form rivals.

runners.name: Stylish Affair
runners.comment: Started career with promising 6f run; well adrift since; this level makes more sense
runners.spotlight: Started career with a promising 6f turf run but she's been well adrift in three starts since, the last two for this yard; ordinary handicaps make more sense but she still has to prove her worth off this mark.

runners.name: Al Baarez
runners.comment: All 3 starts at 6f; minor promise; bred to appreciate 7f; more realistic chance today
runners.spotlight: All three starts at 6f, showing minor promise on debut and facing a tough task back from a break at Kempton in May; this extra furlong can suit on pedigree and has a more realistic chance now handicapping; blinkers on.

runners.name: Dark Sorceress
runners.comment: Off the mark over 6f here in March; well held last twice; return to this track offers hope
runners.spotlight: Off the mark over 6f on this course in March but down the field in her latest two handicaps (first-time headgear on penultimate start); the return to this track offers hope but others more likely now back at 7f.

runners.name: City Captain
runners.comment: Winning yard debut on turf (6f); can progress off 2lb higher now back at 7f
runners.spotlight: Fine sprinting family; successful siblings have won on Polytrack and dirt; qualified for an ordinary mark for previous yard and he extricated himself neatly from an awkward position to lead near the line on yard debut at Pontefract (6f) in April; up just 2lb; can progress back at 7f.

runners.name: Ceira G
runners.comment: Off the mark over C&D in February; shade luckless next time; excuses since
runners.spotlight: Buckled down well when off the mark over C&D in February and was a shade unfortunate not to follow up at Wolverhampton (7f); never sighted next time and she had no reserves over 1m on turf since but there should be another race for her when things pan out.

5:35.race_name: bet365 EBF Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Band D) (EBF Qualifier) (GBB/IRE Incentive) (Div II)

runners.name: Amorist
runners.comment: 45,000euros yearling but only £7,000 as a breeze-up 2yo; probably best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: 45,000euros yearling by Kodiac; £7,000 breeze-up 2yo; first foal; dam unraced half-sister to Italian Listed winners Black Mambazo (5f/5.5f including 2yo) and Diglett (5.5f 2yo), out of Listed-placed 6f 2yo winner; probably best watched on debut.

runners.name: Azleet
runners.comment: By Tasleet; half-sister to 7f 2yo (RPR 91) winner; market can guide on this debut
runners.spotlight: By Tasleet; seventh foal; half-sister to winners Garrel Glen (7f 2yo; RPR 91) and Bracken Brae (1m5f-2m AW; 80); dam 7f winner (including AW; 73), half-sister to 5f-7f winner Clumber Place, out of 1m4f winning half-sister to US 1m2f Grade 1 winner Bequest; market can guide on this debut.

runners.name: Caitlin G
runners.comment: 1,000gns yearling by Bangkok, who's already off the mark as a sire; tongue tied for debut
runners.spotlight: 1,000gns yearling; second foal; dam French 1m 2yo winner, out of French 5f 2yo Listed winner; by Bangkok, who's already off the mark with one of only two representatives; tongue tie on for her introduction.

runners.name: Flying Macs
runners.comment: Green on her debut (5f); should do better and this extra furlong will likely help
runners.spotlight: Dam unraced half-sister to winners Sabbeeh (smart 6f-1m), Bongiorno (useful 1m2f) and Dream Day (useful 6f 2yo); drifted in the market prior to running green when seventh of ten on her debut at Wolverhampton (5f, Tapeta) last month; can surely do better and this extra furlong should help.

runners.name: Khuskhas
runners.owner: C J Murfitt, J Meade, S Smith
runners.comment: 15,000gns yearling who makes appeal on paper but is drawn widest for this introduction
runners.spotlight: 15,000gns yearling; April (third) foal; half-sister to 5f/6f winner Delirious Dream (including 2yo/Qatar; RPR 82); dam unraced half-sister to winners Westover (dual 1m4f Group 1), Monarchs Glen (1m1f Group 3) and Fabilis (useful 7f 2yo-1m4f); by Palace Pier, who's already off the mark from just three runners; makes plenty of appeal on paper but the draw has not been kind for this debut.

runners.name: Lexington Express
runners.comment: Outpaced and beaten a fair way on her 5f debut (good to firm) 26 days ago; needs much more
runners.spotlight: 16-1 when outpaced and beaten just over 16l on her introduction at Leicester (5f, good to firm) 26 days ago; AW debut and she's related to winners on this surface; extra furlong also a positive but she needs to find a good chunk of improvement.

runners.name: Miss Ayala
runners.comment: Half-sister to two AW winners; yard 0-8 with 2yos this year; best watched on debut
runners.spotlight: By James Garfield; fourth foal; half-sister to winners Mr Baloo (7f-9.5f including AW/2yo; RPR 97) and Kodiman (1m2f AW; 76); dam placed 7f AW (76); stable is 0-8 with its juveniles this year and this one's likely best watched on debut.

runners.name: Miss Ruby
runners.comment: Stable is 0-63 with its juveniles and this one was beaten a long way on her debut (5f)
runners.spotlight: By Tasleet; fourth foal; half-sister to winners Uffington (Qatar 1m2f; RPR 83) and Perfect View (6f 2yo; 75); dam 7f winner (72), out of 6f/1m winning half-sister to 5f/6f Group 3 winner Orientor; beaten a long way at Southwell (5f) in April and yard is 0-63 with 2yos.

runners.name: Nifty
runners.comment: Good debut third (5f, good to firm); extra furlong a plus; sets the standard on AW debut
runners.spotlight: Drifted in the market prior to finishing a good debut third at Salisbury (5f, good to firm) 12 days ago, keeping on well despite not always seeing daylight; today's extra furlong should suit and she sets a clear standard on this AW debut.

runners.name: Rejjien
runners.owner: Mrs T Burns & Mrs S Loughnane
runners.comment: Not much to show for two runs; Rossa Ryan takes over but best watched on her AW debut
runners.spotlight: Finished last on her Bath debut (5f) and only marginal improvement stepped up to this trip when sixth of eight at Brighton (good) next time; Rossa Ryan takes over but she has work to do; AW debut.

runners.name: Sovereign Bright
runners.comment: 15,000gns yearling; stamina in the family but sire should help for this trip; debut
runners.spotlight: 15,000gns yearling by Ten Sovereigns; eighth foal; half-sister to six winners including Zoffee (11.4f-2m2f Flat including AW, RPR 104; 2m hurdle/2m1f chase), Crystal Flyer (1m2f/1m4f including AW; 101) and Al Neksh (1m-1m2f; 99); dam 1m4f AW winner (72), out of 1m4f Group 3 winner; plenty of stamina in the pedigree but sire should help for this trip; debutante.

runners.name: Who Is Alice
runners.comment: 9,500gns foal; dam won as a 2yo; market should be helpful ahead of this introduction
runners.spotlight: 9,500gns (sixth) foal; half-sister to 5f winner Over Spiced (including second 2yo start; RPR 78) and to Belgian winners Lady Magda (10.5f-13.5f) and Vive La Danse (10.5f-13.5f); dam 6f/7f winner (including 2yo; 94); market should be helpful ahead of this introduction.

9:00.race_name: Celtic Subaru Supporting Ffos Las Racecourse Handicap Hurdle
9:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.1)

runners.name: Land Afar

prev_owners.owner: This Horse Is For Sale Partnership

runners.comment: Won Ludlow claimer last year before form dipped; change of yard needs to spark a revival.
runners.spotlight: Won a claimer at Ludlow (2m, good to soft) in December, then finished a respectable second of four in a novice the following month; however, form eventually tailed off and he was last seen suffering a heavy odds-on defeat in an Exeter seller in April; has since joined Daniel Bourne and change of scenery needs to spark a revival.

quotes.race: Jennings Meats (Ladies Pro/Am) INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Land Afar was a wee bit keen at Cork and the ground was bad that day. I was a little concerned about running him today because he's such a big horse and I was wondering would he let himself down on the ground, but he did and won well - Anthony McCann, trainer.

runners.name: Twist Of Fatecatch
runners.comment: Won well at Fontwell; handicap debut form boosted since and a key player off same mark.
runners.spotlight: Didn't need to improve on his hurdling debut second in order to open his account at Fontwell (2m3f, good) with some authority and, although a beaten favourite on last month's handicap debut, that form is working out well with several behind running solid races since; major player off the same mark.

runners.name: Mohawk Chief

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith
Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

runners.comment: Back to best hurdle form when close 3rd at Market Rasen; fair mark on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Soft-ground winner as a 2yo for Aidan O'Brien; back to best hurdle form when a staying-on close third of six at Market Rasen (2m4f, good to soft) in March in first-time cheekpieces (retained); makes his handicap debut off what appears a fair mark.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well last time out at Market Rasen when third behind Moonset over hurdles in first-time cheekpieces and has been in good form. He was a good little Flat horse in Ireland when trained by Aidan O'Brien and hopefully now we'll get a couple of wins with him over the summer. If he progresses you don't know where you'll end up with that sort of horse. Once he gets his head in front I'm sure he'll win one or two more hopefully. 26-03-25

runners.name: Djo Dela Barriere
runners.comment: Back in form with Plumpton win and fair third here after; more likely needed though.
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner, most recently when emerging from a slump in form at Plumpton (2m4f, good) last month, then a close third of four here (3m, good) two weeks ago; more exposed than most but Eleanor Williams' 7lb claim will help.

stable_tour.quote: I'd say he was lucky to win probably the worst novice hurdle to be run this year, at Hereford in November. I think that was good placing by the trainer! He ran okay the other day at Plumpton, when he was fourth, but his mark of 115 is very overrated and he has no chance of winning off that. He'll be a bit of sport around the country and will pick up some prize-money, but in my view he's way too high in the handicap to be winning. 24-12-24

runners.name: New Found Fame
runners.comment: Two wins at Bangor in December and February (2m3f and 2m) but proving inconsistent
runners.spotlight: Bangor winner (2m3f, soft) in December and, after a lesser effort the following month, won back there (2m, soft) in February; however he's not the easiest to predict and was comfortably held at Chepstow in April; he comes with risk.

quotes.race: White Lion At Weston Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was a very nice debut from New Found Fame and he's a very well-bred horse. He's showed us all the right signs at home and we knew he needed soft ground. He's a little bit delicate so I wanted to come to a lower key meeting and give him a nice experience. He did it really nicely and I hope he'll be a three-mile chaser - Kerry Lee, trainer.

runners.name: Balkardy
runners.comment: Mostly below best since October chase win; may be vulnerable  at 2m4f back hurdling
runners.spotlight: Mostly below best since scoring over fences at Stratford (2m6f, soft) in October but was in contention when falling two out Ludlow in February; likely still as effective over hurdles, but the drop back to this trip against some improvers may leave him vulnerable.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well when narrowly denied over hurdles at Newton Abbot last time. He's a tough, genuine little horse and I'd imagine he'll run over fences at some point this season, although we may mix and match it with him. He's a good one for the small tracks and is versatile in terms of the ground and trip. 02-11-23

A tough, genuine handicapper. He won at Stratford in early October and was third at Ludlow last week behind Tightenourbelts. He's not very big and fences get in his way sometimes, but he's very genuine. He's a joy to have around the place and I hope he can carry on giving a good account of himself. 24-12-24

6:15.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.1)

runners.name: Do It Like A Dude
runners.comment: Absent for two years after Irish point win; ran okay on recent rules debut
runners.spotlight: Absent for over two years after his winning Irish point debut in May 2023 and probably didn't achieve a huge amount when third of five on last month's rules debut at Fontwell (2m5f, good) but that recent outing might have brought him on and he has possibilities here.

runners.name: Jour Dorage
runners.comment: Well beaten on both hurdling starts for Simon Earle last year; now with new stable
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on both hurdling starts for Simon Earle last year; makes stable debut in a much weaker race (same owner) but has fitness to prove after 251-day absence; of interest only if lively in the betting.

runners.name: Reina Del Mar
runners.comment: Became rather disappointing over hurdles in Ireland but has good claims here
runners.spotlight: Useful Flat racer who was creditable second of 14 at Cork (2m4f, good) on hurdling debut for Joseph O'Brien in November; became rather disappointing for that stable afterwards and was sold for 10,000gns in March but makes debut for Tim Vaughan in a modest race.

quotes.race: Turners Handicap
quotes.quote: I'm delighted because Reina Del Mar travelled like a dream on that ground and she won it really well. She was off with an injury for about 18 months and it's taken her a couple of runs to get her fitness back, but she came third here a few weeks back and she's going the right way - David Ward, owner.

quotes.race: Discover Newmarket Handicap
quotes.quote: Reina Del Mar had quite a rare injury last year and the owners have been very patient. The ground was far too firm for her at Windsor last time and the rain they had here this morning has helped - Ed Walker, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's doing well, but she carries a lot of weight and takes a bit of getting fit. She's not quite there yet and I see her being a mare who will get better with racing and come into her own towards late summer. 23-04-24
She missed the whole of last season due to injury and I hope she's a well-handicapped mare. She had a workout at Kempton earlier this month and went nicely.  27-04-23

runners.name: Scene Stealer
runners.comment: Has shown only minor promise under rules; recent point form is underwhelming
runners.spotlight: Came second in a good-ground bumper for Gary Brown in summer 2023 and was not disgraced in a heavy-ground novice hurdle in December 2024 but this year's two point runs for Myles Osborne were very underwhelming; now with another new trainer for this rules return.

runners.name: Sure To Please
runners.comment: Has made low-key start to hurdling career this spring; moves up in trip today
runners.spotlight: Showed only minor promise in bumpers last season and has made a low-key start to her hurdling career this spring; only fourth best on merit when well-held third of six here (2m, good) last month; moves up in trip.

7:20.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.1)

runners.name: Queenie St Clair
runners.comment: Last of seven in Bellewstown maiden on latest outing in April and now 0-7 over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Last of seven in Bellewstown maiden on latest outing in April and now 0-7 over hurdles; considered only if lively in the betting here.

runners.name: Believe Jack
runners.breeder: S C E A Du Haras Des Sablonnets
runners.comment: Pulled up in two handicaps last spring; returns from one-year layoff with lots to prove
runners.spotlight: Won twice in plating company for Olly Murphy in 2023-24 season but was pulled up in two handicaps for new stable last spring and returns from one-year absence with a lot to prove.

runners.name: Linden Lane
runners.comment: Not obviously well treated for h'cap debut but showed promise in all three qualifying runs
runners.spotlight: Displayed clear promise in all three qualifying runs, most recently when second of three behind short-odds winner at Newton Abbot (2m1f, good) in May; not obviously well treated for handicap debut but remains unexposed.

runners.name: Jokers N Clowns
runners.comment: Runner-up in two maidens in April but well beaten in a handicap for new stable last month
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish mare; came second in two good-ground maidens (2m5f/2m) for Billy Aprahamian in April but was well beaten in Hereford handicap (2m3f, good) for new stable last month and needs to leave that effort behind; hood removed after one use.

runners.name: Gavin
runners.comment: Dominated from the front over C&D last month and has excuse for subsequent defeat
runners.spotlight: Returned from winter break with two good runs, the latter a very dominant C&D (good) win from the front one month ago; well beaten under a penalty a few days later, having suffered a wound to his hoof, but remains well handicapped on older form; major player if back on song.

runners.name: Catboy
runners.comment: Won in September but absent since a poor run in December; headgear left off today
runners.spotlight: Scored in first-cheekpieces at Fontwell (2m1f, good to soft) in September and bettered that performance when clear second at Musselburgh (2m4f, good to soft) in December; absent since running poorly just before Christmas, though, and the headgear is missing here.

runners.name: Bobbys Fortune
runners.comment: Unable to justify market support on final two starts last season; now 0-7 over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Unable to justify solid market support on final two appearances last season (pulled up/beaten 38l) and has now been unplaced all seven hurdling starts; evidently thought capable of better, though, and it will be interesting to see whether his supporters wade in again; drops back in trip; cheekpieces removed after one use.

6:45.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.1)

runners.name: Puddlesinthepark
runners.comment: Dual chase winner this year; did it stylishly last time and must be considered here
runners.spotlight: Dual chase winner this year; did it very stylishly from off the pace at Newton Abbot (3m2f, heavy) in April and will be fine on the quicker surface here; must be considered.

runners.name: To Be Sure
runners.breeder: Mrs Tessa Greatrex & Mr D Futter
runners.comment: Unreliable nowadays but ran well last time and has a C&D win on his CV
runners.spotlight: On the downgrade now and has become inconsistent but gave good account when clear second off today's mark at Fakenham (3m, good) in April and has a C&D win on his CV; helps to give Evan Williams a good hand in this race.

runners.name: Socialiser

prev_owners.owner: The Gold And Silver Club (miss J Davis-King)

runners.comment: Still unexposed under rules but was well beaten in two handicaps chases last season
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in Fakenham hunter chase (3m, good) on rules debut in May 2022 but did not reappear until last season and his first two runs in handicap chases were very disappointing; needs to prove some ability remains.

stable_tour.quote: He was placed in a couple of points-to-points before getting his head in front at Charm Park in Yorkshire. He was second on his debut for us in a hunter chase but sustained an injury so has been off since, but I'm looking forward to having him back in our team this winter. He'll appreciate soft ground. 06-11-24

This winning pointer has a fabulous pedigree, being by Milan from the family of Simonsig, Dusart and Drumcliff. He came to us after winning his point at Charm Park by an easy 12 lengths. I wanted to give him a run before the summer break and he was second in a maiden hunter chase at Fakenham in the spring. For a horse who clearly needs a stiff track on softer ground, that was very encouraging on such a tight course. He'll start off novice hurdling and clearly has the ability to win races. 05-10-22

runners.name: Unspeakable
runners.comment: Came good over fences at Taunton in April and last month's run was perfectly respectable
runners.spotlight: Came good over fences with fast-ground win at Taunton (2m7f, good to firm) in April, his seventh attempt, and his subsequent Newton Abbot third (3m2f, good) was perfectly respectable; likely contender.

runners.name: Mistymal
runners.comment: Won at Hereford in October and ended last season with pretty good third there; a possible
runners.spotlight: Scored at Hereford (3m1f, good) in October and ended last season with a pretty good third over that C&D; not always one to rely upon heavily but enters calculations.

stable_tour.quote: He's an ex-Irish point-to-pointer. He looked a nice prospect and ran with credit at Southwell two starts ago, but he couldn't handle Fakenham last time. He wants better ground and a big, galloping track and I'd be gutted if he can't win races for us. 20-03-24

runners.name: Mcgregors Charge
runners.comment: Ran big race when back under rules in April but was tailed off last month; hard to predict
runners.spotlight: Maiden pointer; returned from long absence with big run in defeat at Taunton (2m7f, good to firm) in April but was tailed off at Uttoxeter last month and it's hard to know what to expect from him here.

runners.name: Pennant Legacy
runners.comment: Pulled up on last month's chase/handicap debut; had recent wind op
runners.spotlight: Unexposed after only five runs but showed no promise in novice/maiden hurdles last year and was pulled up here (2m5f, good) on last month's chase/handicap debut; needs recent wind op to have made a massive difference; 12lb out of the weights.

8:30.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.1)

runners.name: Jaitroplaclasse
runners.breeder: David Lumet & Dr V Catherine Lumet
runners.comment: Low-mileage 6yo; placed twice for yard; fourth at Southwell yesterday - more needed.
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 6yo who has been placed on two of his five runs for this stable; faced a stiff task when chasing home a revitalised subsequent winner at Bangor (2m1f, good) last month and faded into fourth at Southwell (2m, good) yesterday; more likely needed if turned out quickly.

stable_tour.quote: Michael Blencowe hasn't had much luck for us and I was hoping this fella, who is beautiful, would change that, but he disappointed at Kempton in March. He looks the part and we just need to unlock his talent. 30-10-23

runners.name: Jaipaletemps

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Herve Guerin, Gabriel Leenders & David Lumet

runners.comment: Yet to fire in Britain, but combination of wind op and 4lb drop makes him one to note.
runners.spotlight: Three chase wins in France (2m1f-2m3f; heavy/very soft) but yet to show the same form in four British starts, on varying ground; still early days for this stable though and dangerous to rule out, especially if strong in the market, having been given wind surgery and now down in the weights.

runners.name: You Say Nothing
runners.comment: Struggled last year but 2-2 this year and remains on a good mark for hat-trick bid.
runners.spotlight: Struggled in 2024 but 2-2 this year, most recently posting a comfortable win at Leicester (2m, good to soft) in March off 6lb lower; remains on a good mark and can give another good account in his hat-trick bid.

quotes.race: John Thomas McNamara Series (Q.R) Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: You Say Nothing got a bit of a freebie out the gate and Joey got his fractions right. He's a big strong horse and gallops through that ground. We'll try and find something similar - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: You Say Nothing got a great ride from Conor. He was a very unlucky faller at Fairyhouse and that was more like it today - Feidhlim Cunningham, assistant trainer

runners.name: Pittsburg
runners.comment: Disappointing on Flat latest; in fine form over fences otherwise of late; shortlisted.
runners.spotlight: Well held back on the Flat latest but in good form over fences prior to that, winning two of his last three starts (2-2 under Freddie Mitchell); nothing wrong with his close second at Market Rasen (2m1f, good) in April; has never won off a mark this high but looks hard to rule out.

runners.name: Lady Gwen

prev_owners.owner: Huw And Richard Davies & N S L Williams

runners.comment: Promising chase debut in October and retains potential after a fair return last month.
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent over hurdles last year but ran well when second on chase debut at Exeter (2m1f, good to soft) in October before running as though something was amiss when pulling up in November; made a satisfactory return at Stratford last month when shaping as though the run might have been needed; remains with chase potential.

runners.name: Imperial Measure
runners.comment: 1-13 but reliable over hurdles; fair chase debut after layoff and worth considering.
runners.spotlight: Only 1-13 but generally reliable over hurdles; shaped with some promise on last month's chase debut after a long absence and is only 1lb higher than his sole hurdles win; possibilities if the reappearance run has brought him forward.

stable_tour.quote: He bled two starts back but he ran well on his return at Taunton. He's difficult to win with as he wobbles and I thought he was going to wobble off the track going to the final hurdle last time. He likes to finish second better than finishing first but he runs his race nine times out of ten. 28-02-24

runners.name: Yorgunnabeplucky
runners.comment: Point-placed but modest over hurdles, including in handicaps the last twice; chase debut.
runners.spotlight: Placed in an Irish point last spring but has offered little over hurdles, including in handicaps this year; has enough to prove on this switch to chasing.

7:55.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.1)

runners.name: Colonial Empire
runners.comment: On a good mark but the new trip and first-time visor need to spark a major revival
runners.spotlight: Has regressed since January's encouraging return from a long absence, most recently when finishing a remote last of five when tried in cheekpieces; on a good mark but the new trip and first-time visor need to spark a major revival.

runners.name: Jacks Jury
runners.comment: Best effort yet when second over C&D on handicap debut last time; respected.
runners.spotlight: Unraced for Nicky Henderson; posted two modest efforts after a promising hurdle/stable debut in February but ran his best race yet when second of six switched to handicaps over C&D (good) last month, staying on well over the longer trip; Shane Fenelon returns and, with his 5lb claim, worth considering.

runners.name: Getuptheyard
runners.comment: 12-race maiden over hurdles but went close off this mark recently over this trip; player.
runners.spotlight: Remains a maiden after 12 attempts over hurdles but has found only one too good on the last three occasions and only just lost out when upped to around this trip at Uttoxeter (good) 11 days ago; due to go back up 3lb and unexposed at the trip, so firmly in the picture.

runners.name: Ferret Jeeter
runners.comment: 12lb rise for his handicap debut win demands more but he'll be suited by this longer trip.
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 8yo who won on handicap debut at Fontwell (near 2m6f, good) last month but got no further than the second returned there (3m2f; evens) 11 days ago; likely to be suited by today's trip and, although the 12lb rise demands more, he's open to progress.

runners.name: Pooroldmackley
runners.comment: Running well until last of four finishers at Newton Abbot (chase) on Wednesday
runners.spotlight: A winner over fences at Newton Abbot (2m5f, heavy) in April who followed up back over hurdles at Hereford (near 2m4f, good) three days later; recent third at Ludlow when ridden by 7lb claimer Eleanor Williams was a solid effort off his new mark but he was last of four finishers at Newton Abbot (chase) on Wednesday; back up in trip.

runners.name: Cher Monsieur
runners.breeder: S C E A De Maulepaire
runners.comment: Has something to prove back on ground than good but this new trip is worth exploring.
runners.spotlight: Left behind some modest efforts over hurdles, including on April's handicap debut, when upped to 2m4f to finish a good staying-on third in the first-time hood at Uttoxeter (good) last month; has something to prove back on softer ground but this new trip is worth exploring; one of two for the stable.

runners.name: Inspector Lynley
runners.breeder: Mrs H R Cross & Mrs S A Keys
runners.comment: Reappearance behind Ferret Jeeter may have been needed; softer ground is a worry though.
runners.spotlight: 1-16 over hurdles with that win coming at Stratford (2m6f) on good ground last July off this mark; finished 25l adrift of Ferret Jeeter on last month's reappearance but that run may have been needed and more of a concern would be any further softening of the ground; one of two runners for the stable.

runners.name: Talk Of The Moon
runners.owner: E Hawkings A Lofts B Harding M Harris
runners.comment: Not without ability but she's probably best watched after such a long absence.
runners.spotlight: Third of 16 at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good to soft) on second handicap start but that was nearly two and a half years ago and she's probably best watched back from a such a long absence.

runners.name: Mind Hunter
runners.breeder: Saleh Al Homaizi & Imad Al Sagar
runners.comment: Goes considerably up in trip but struggling for form since returning from an absence.
runners.spotlight: Returned in October from a long absence and has struggled on his four starts since, three over hurdles; goes considerably up in distance.

runners.name: Mistertommyshelby
runners.comment: Came back to some form over fences latest but more required again back over over hurdles.
runners.spotlight: 18-race maiden who was out of sorts over hurdles last season but returned to some form back from break and reverting to fences when a close third of seven from 7lb out of the weights at Southwell (3m, good) in April; out of the weights again back over hurdles and others appeal more.

3:42.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.6)

runners.name: Korker
runners.owner: Fine Claret Racing,Mrs Burke & C Wood

prev_owners.owner: Fine Claret Racing & More Turf Racing

runners.comment: Talented sprinter; ran to high level at York last month; 6f on slow ground may stretch him
runners.spotlight: Not at his best on AW on his first two starts of the season but he ran as well as he ever has when third of 16 at York's Dante meeting three weeks ago (6f, good to firm); fully effective on slower ground but the combination of 6f and rain-softened ground might just see his stamina ebb away.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Ayr Gold Cup Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Korker seemed to get away reasonably well, he was tracking the pace and he finished strongly - Karl Burke, trainer.

quotes.race: Sri Lanka, The Jewel Of Asia Handicap
quotes.quote: Korker was very good and he especially jumped the gates nicely. He was very relaxed at the start and he picked them off. He bumped into a horse rated 111 at Ascot [Emaraaty Ana] and wasn't far behind him. His last three runs have been very good and he's been frustrating at the gates before, but he's really come on. He's grown up now. He's got a bit of a confidence booster now and after speaking to the boss that might be it for the year, so he'd be ending it on a high - Clifford Lee, rider.

quotes.race: Eddie And Violet Smith Conditions Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Korker has been so unlucky as he keeps missing the break and deserves his win. I've ridden him loads and when he doesn't miss the break, he never actually races through, but when you miss it slightly he hits the frame. He didn't miss it today, but we couldn't get into stride in the first furlong. I thought we were going to get lapped but he really got me back into it - Clifford Lee, jockey.

quotes.race: Longines Irish Champions Weekend Handicap
quotes.quote: Korker was very relaxed for a sprinter. He'll go for the Holyroodhouse Handicap at Royal Ascot.

quotes.race: Lee Thomas Christy Memorial Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Korber is a little bit quirky in the stalls, hence he goes in last with the hood on, but he jumped reasonably quickly and had a nice smooth run. He's a high-class horse, who we've thrown in the deep end, and he's proved he's got a lot of ability. We'll see what Listed races are around for him and I'm sure he'll be a lovely horse next year - Karl Burke, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a proper 5f horse who finished last year really well and has finally started to jump properly. He should have been a Royal Ascot winner but he got left ten lengths in the Holyroodhouse two years ago and got beaten by three and a half. If he keeps jumping, he's a Listed/Group 3 horse. He doesn't mind cut in the ground. 03-04-24

A horse I have a lot of time for. He was most unfortunate not to win on his debut at York last year when missing the break, giving up several lengths and only going down by a head. He has not done a lot wrong since, winning three times as a juvenile and ending up the season on a mark of 92. On his second run this season at York last time he defied top weight with an impressive win over 5f, but the handicapper has really hammered him hard with a 9lb rise. He was going for the Holyroodhouse after that but it will be tough now off 104. We will still head to the royal meeting and see how that pans out, but off his new mark we will have to start looking at Listed and Group 3 races for him. I think there is more to come - I certainly hope so after such a sharp hike in his mark. 01-06-22

runners.name: Commanche Falls
runners.owner: Doug Graham, Ian Davison, Alan Drysdale
runners.comment: Powers perhaps on the wane but edging down the weights; can step up on recent efforts
runners.spotlight: Two Stewards' Cups and a host of other big-race wins on his CV, including over C&D; down to his lowest mark in nearly four years and should step up on what we've seen from him so far in 2024.

quotes.race: BetGoodwin Garrowby Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Commanche Falls has been better than ever. He did well to win at Newbury because the ground was against him and Ireland last time came too soon, but the horse that beat him [Moss Tucker] just won the big sprint [Flying Five]. He probably ran better than we thought there. He's in a few races, including at the Curragh again, but the ground is important to him. He won't run a lot more this season as he's done so well - Michael Dods, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Hackwood Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Between the three and the two-furlong marker I felt like I was getting a bit stuck in the ground really. Commanche Falls does race behind the bridle but normally you can keep your momentum going, whereas today I just felt like I wasn't getting any momentum. There wasn't much room and I just had to switch him to get him to think again and, once he did that, he really put his head down and I thought he did it nicely in the end - Conor Beasley, jockey.

quotes.race: Jebel Ali Racecourse & Stables Dash Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I was very confident. On his last run Commanche Falls was third behind some smart fillies at York, though this ground would be plenty quick enough for him. If he's off the bridle at halfway, you know he's going to come home strong. Once he met the rising ground and I gave him a dig he went about his job really well - Connor Beasley, jockey.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Ayr Gold Cup Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Commanche Falls has run a blinder but Connor (Beasley) said they didn't carry him far enough, he's travelling so much better in his races. But it was a super run with the weight and I'm delighted with him, he'll probably go in a Listed race now - Michael Dods, trainer.

quotes.race: Coral Stewards' Cup (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: I was a little behind the bridle but I needed to keep tabs on the front ones. The race fell apart in front of me but when I felt Hollie coming to me I felt Commanche Falls go again and really stick his head down. I sat on him on Wednesday and I was very happy with him coming into this and I think he's the sort of horse who just comes to light at this time of year and it's a great training performance to bring him back to win this again - Connor Beasley, jockey.

quotes.race: Unibet Stewards' Cup (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Commanche Falls is just a horse who has got better and better with each run. Every time he comes to a gig he keeps putting up his best performance ever. The ground was a question mark today but I knew once I got him rolling, he'd pull out all the stops - Connor Beasley, jockey.

quotes.race: Close Brothers Asset Management Handicap
quotes.quote: We always thought Commanche Falls wanted a bit further but he's done it again over this trip. He has a good mind and got the job done - Connor Beasley, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a great servant. The big handicaps suit him because he needs a proper gallop in a race and needs to be off the bridle. He won a Group 3 at Newbury and two Listed races last season but they weren't exactly great races for the level and so he got away with the step up from handicaps. This year, though, they've been tough races. We had him entered in the Stewards' Cup but the problem was that when the weights came out he was on a mark of 110. However, by the time of the race he had dropped to 107 and we felt there was no point running him off a mark 3lb higher than his actual rating, so that's why we missed the race.  He ran on Saturday at York, finishing a great third behind Elmonjed. I've entered him in the Beverley Bullet on Saturday but I'm not sure whether he'll run yet. There are other races coming up at York and there's the Ayr Gold Cup. 28-08-24

runners.name: Tropical Island
runners.comment: Won well at Ripon (6f, good) on her return but she's up 7lb against better opposition
runners.spotlight: Ran out the easy winner of a Class 3 fillies' handicap at Ripon (6f, good) on her return 18 days ago but that wasn't a strong race for the grade and she's been hiked up 7lb; rain shouldn't be an issue and she did threaten to be useful last season but this will demand another step forward.

runners.name: Aleezdancer
runners.comment: Well treated on 2024 best; sharper for reappearance; the more rain the better for him
runners.spotlight: 2lb lower than for his York win last May; made a low-key return to action at Newcastle last month but every drop of rain to fall will be in his favour and he's an interesting contender; stable also run Vantheman.

quotes.race: Churchill Tyres Handicap
quotes.quote: We popped the blinkers on Aleezdancer as he's been around a fair while now and thought he might be a bit cute. He's very genuine, but needed something a bit different and Neil said he worked a treat. He was quite lazy in the first furlong but then came good and travelled into it. They went fast but he loves a pace like that, I was always confident a furlong down that they couldn't keep going and he was coming good. He was a little bit unlucky in the Stewards' Cup last year. He's had two quick races so we'll freshen him up now and make a plan for the rest of the year - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: Mental Health Awareness Handicap
quotes.quote: Aleezdancer is not very big but he's gutsy and he loves this ground. My main hope for him is the Ayr Gold Cup. He's no good in the summer as he likes cut in the ground - Jack Berry, joint-owner.

stable_tour.quote: He was impressive at York, then hated the track at Epsom, which can happen. He's ground dependent, he needs ease in it. 10-06-24

runners.name: Vantheman
runners.comment: Back to last winning mark and this less demanding than the two races he's run in this year
runners.spotlight: 6f win as a 2yo; strong 5f form last season, winning twice (AW and good turf); looked to retain ability on his reappearance (6f) but never dangerous at York (5f) three weeks ago; one of two runners for the stable.

runners.name: Fahrenheit Seven
runners.comment: Good strike-rate in sprint handicaps and not fully exposed; rain no problem; chance
runners.spotlight: Sprint handicapper with a useful strike-rate, and his Pontefract win (5f, good) in April was his fourth from just 11 attempts; stretched by 7f at Newmarket when last seen seven weeks ago; rain won't hurt and his rider takes off a handy 3lb.

runners.name: Count Dorsay
runners.comment: Well held on return but ground will suit better today; out of weights but not dismissed
runners.spotlight: Into the veteran stage but won four times in a productive second half of 2024; the more rain to fall the better and today's test should be far more suitable than the fast-ground event he tackled at Doncaster on his reappearance; out of the weights and not easily recommended but he represents the stable who have won two of the last four runnings; could go well at a price.

quotes.race: EMS Copiers Supporting Kildare Chamber Maiden
quotes.quote: Count D'Orsay is very hard to place over five furlongs here. He goes to the July sales now and is probably off a very good mark looking at that - Charles O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He loves soft ground and I'll definitely try him over an easy six furlongs this season; he runs through the line well over five. He ran really well over five and a half in the Portland last year and that will be a good race for him again. 02-05-22

3:12.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.6)

runners.name: Haptics
runners.comment: Ex-French; slipped to a handy mark and last run may have come too quickly; interesting
runners.spotlight: Multiple turf/AW winner in France but, although to win for this yard he's slipped to a handy mark and last run may have come too quickly on the back of an encouraging reappearance; interesting.

runners.name: Sea Legend
runners.comment: Isn't a regular winner but running well and worth another try over this sort of trip
runners.spotlight: Only one win from 17 starts Flat and jumping but has run creditably the last twice over 1m2f and worth another try over this sort of distance (didn't get home only previous run over 1m6f); another to consider.

quotes.race: Download The Raceday Ready App Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: We got Sea Legend but he had a problem in behind so he had to have a long time off. We gelded him and the last month he's gone nicely. He enjoyed that trip, he's got a big, long stride and I'm really pleased with that on his first run back. It was a relief to go to the races and run so well. I think he'll be suited by a mile and a half and we'll look at all the options in those nice handicaps. That was his first run for a year, so we wanted to get it out the way before making plans - James Fanshawe, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice, big horse. He's had problems but I'm hopefully quite good at fixing them. I'm looking forward to him, mainly for his pedigree. Sea The Stars was one of my favourite horses and he's good at producing top horses. 07-05-25

runners.name: Dreams Adozen
runners.breeder: S A R L Al Shahania Stud France
runners.comment: Stays much further and may not want things to turn tactical dropping to this trip
runners.spotlight: Course winner over 1m3f in 2023 but stays much further, as she's shown at Chester on last two starts and may not want things to become tactical dropped to this distance.

quotes.race: Horseradish Catering & Events Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Dreams Adozen handled the ground. It's absolutely bottomless but she ploughed through it, maybe the others didn't go in the ground - Joe Fanning, jockey.

runners.name: Tokyo Bay
runners.comment: Maiden winner who gets headgear; hasn't progressed in handicaps and needs to raise game
runners.spotlight: 1m4f heavy ground maiden winner last spring; hasn't progressed in handicaps and, although cheekpieces are added, he'll have to raise his game if he's to bag a first handicap.

runners.name: Spanish Hustle
runners.comment: Goes well here, stays 1m5f and ran well last time; high in the weights but can't rule out
runners.spotlight: Only fifth in this last year but is 4-13 at this venue and shaped as though coming to hand here last month; should run well, although doesn't look to have much in hand off current mark.

runners.name: Model Approach
runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner for this yard but below best on Flat and over hurdles on last two runs
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner for this yard but below best on Flat and over hurdles on last two starts; tongue-tie now fitted but plenty more needed.

quotes.race: Join Racing TV Today Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Mr [Jim] Bolger told me he'd win the Triumph Hurdle after I bought him. He could go for something at Cheltenham in November - Adrian Keatley, trainer.

runners.name: Two Auld Pals
runners.comment: Won this race from a 4lb higher mark last year; encouraging run last week and a player
runners.spotlight: Won this under Oisin Orr from 4lb higher mark last year (third course win) and shaped as though coming to hand here last week; handles most ground and he's an interesting runner.

runners.name: Ebony Maw
runners.owner: B Jordan, Brian Jordan, S Jordan & N Mcconnell

prev_owners.owner: B Jordan, Brian Jordan, S Jordan & N McConnell

runners.comment: Respectable efforts both runs this season and claims, despite dropping in distance
runners.spotlight: Close second to Two Auld Pals in this last year, albeit now worse off at the weights; has run respectably on both starts this season and likely to go well, despite dropping in trip.

quotes.race: Metges Lane Maiden
quotes.quote: Ebony Maw did that lovely. He's still green, he dosn't have many miles on the clock, and he wouldn't want the ground any better than yielding. There could be a nice handicap in him over 1m2f plus - Shane Lyons, assistant trainer

4:12.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.6)

runners.name: Indalo
runners.comment: Respectable effort on turf debut  and shapes like he'll stay; hood left off; claims
runners.spotlight: AW novice winner who ran respectably on turf debut after a near three-month absence last time; hood worn for last three starts now left off and shapes like he'll stay this longer trip; can do better.

stable_tour.quote: He took a while to come to hand last year before winning his novice at Newcastle in November and he's still a few weeks away from running. He's very laid-back and should be capable of developing through the summer as he gains further experience. There's a valuable race at Gowran [Gowran Classic] at the start of June which he qualifies for. 25-04-24

runners.name: Good Heavens
runners.comment: Dual winner in Ireland; disappointing since last win but starts the season on a good mark
runners.spotlight: Dual winner over 1m in Ireland but, although he's not had much racing, he's been disappointing since last win in 2022; has dropped a fair way in the weights and will be one to note if the market speaks on first run since September.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Supporting TREO EILE (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: His experience stood to him and it was a good performance. I'm not sure what they are like behind Good Heavens but he couldn't have done it any better today. Getting a lead was a good help to him and he quickened up well - Frank Berry, representing owner JP McManus.

stable_tour.quote: He has plenty of experience from the Flat and has schooled well over hurdles. His Flat form is good enough to suggest he can make the grade as a juvenile hurdler. He went very close off a mark of 98 in the Irish Cambridgeshire, only just beaten by one of our four-year-olds. He's a homebred out of an unraced Galileo mare, so it's not a jumping pedigree, but we've had horses by Zoffany who have taken well to hurdling, and I'm looking forward to getting him started. 20-10-22

runners.name: Bubbles Wonky
runners.comment: Matched best effort when second over C&D last time; reproduction of that gives him claims
runners.spotlight: Stepped up on reappearance form when second over C&D last time; drawn much wider this time but no surprise to see him run well.

quotes.race: Robert Kemp-Ambler Memorial/British EBF Novice Stakes (Horses With No More Than 3 Runs) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Bubbles Wonky obviously has a bit of talent. Tim has experience of the family as he trained his older half-brother Mahanakhon and they're quite similar, he's a very straightforward type of horse. He travelled well and quickened nicely when I let him down - Sean Kirrane, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's training really well and we think he's pretty good. I think a mile is probably his trip and he seems to go well with give in the ground. 23-04-24

runners.name: Pisanello

prev_owners.owner: Haras D'Etreham, Riviera Equine Sarl & Ecurie De Montlahuc

runners.comment: Isn't consistent but likes it here and on a handy mark; last run may have come too quickly
runners.spotlight: Isn't the most consistent but he's a dual course winner who shaped as though retaining much of ability on reappearance; next run may have come too quickly but is on a handy mark and is worth another chance.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Beverley on his comeback and then ran a nice race in the Thirsk Hunt Cup. A nice, big horse with some reasonable form in France, he could have a good enough summer and might run at York this week. 09-05-22

runners.name: Yermanthere
runners.comment: Triple 7f winner who returned to form last time; not certain to back it up, though
runners.spotlight: Not always easy to catch right but is a triple 7f winner who returned to form last time (despite hanging right); wouldn't be certain to back it up over the longest trip he's tackled, though.

quotes.race: Londis Roscommon Handicap
quotes.quote: Yermanthere had his conditions today and he had been working very well at home - Andrew Kinirons, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's another who has had a good break since joining us. We decided to wait for the summer with horses like him who look to be well handicapped; that's where the money and the races are. It looks as though he's a seven-furlong horse. 23-04-24

runners.name: Hale End
runners.comment: All wins have been over 1m but seems to stay this trip and respectable efforts of late
runners.spotlight: Has won four times over a mile, including at this venue, and seems to stay this trip; respectable efforts on last two starts and each-way claims in an open event.

runners.name: King Chaos
runners.comment: Novice winner over 1m in December but hasn't bettered that in handicaps; now back on turf
runners.spotlight: Novice winner over 1m at Southwell in December but hasn't bettered that form since, including in a visor last time; cheekpieces fitted this time but plenty to prove back on grass.

runners.name: Mister Daydream
runners.comment: Dual winner over further in spring but below best on last two starts; could bounce back
runners.spotlight: Two wins over further (including one at this venue) in spring but below that level on last two starts, disappointing at Ayr last time; as one from this yard could easily bounce back, though.

runners.name: Epidavros
runners.comment: Not at best on quick ground here last time and chance will likely improve with rain
runners.spotlight: Dual winner last September, including over C&D, but failed to match this year's efforts when returned to fast ground last time; her chance will likely increase if the ground eases.

runners.name: Shine On Brendan
runners.comment: Multiple winner at this venue but below best this year and goes back up in grade
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner at this venue but hasn't been at best on either start this year; is down to a handy mark but he has a bit to prove back up in grade.
