stable_tour.quote: He joined us in the spring still a maiden after 25 runs, but he's really come alive since arriving here. I'd like to take all the credit but he's ridden by 74-year-old Jack Grey, who has done an amazing job. Jack has found the key to him and he has gone from strength to strength, winning five times and charging up the handicap from 47 to 69. Paul [Mulrennan] had ridden him before and told me he was much better than his form and he could be having a problem with his breathing, and a wind operation has clearly helped him. He's showing no signs of either regression or tiredness and, while he's in that form, I have every hope he can add another win very soon. 12-09-22

runners.name: Detective
runners.comment: Has won here and is another on a handy mark but he's held by Hale End on recent Ayr form
runners.spotlight: Carlisle specialist who won over 1m3f at this venue in 2022; patchy form since last win and, although 2lb below last winning mark, he's held by Hale End on Ayr form and will do well to win this.

runners.name: Beltane
runners.comment: Had plenty of chances since last win; may struggle back up in grade from out of handicap
runners.spotlight: Has had a stack of chances since last win but seems to have found his level judged on latest starts; more to do from just out of the weights back up in distance.

4:43.race_name: William Berkeley Harris-Burland Memorial Celebrations Handicap
4:43.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.6)

runners.name: Deputy
runners.comment: Back to winning ways in October but not seen since and ideally suited by plenty of cut
runners.spotlight: Goes particularly well on a soft surface and back to winning ways in October; no great record fresh, though, so best watched from this 5lb higher mark on his first outing since.

runners.name: Sir Garfield
runners.comment: 3lb well following an improved effort at Carlisle; has few options from draw but claims
runners.spotlight: In good form recently and 3lb well in on the back of an improved effort at Carlisle last week; yet to race at this venue and drawn on the wing but likely to give a good account.

runners.name: Taygar
runners.comment: Triple sprint winner; creditable third at Redcar last time and has each-way claims
runners.spotlight: Triple sprint winner who bettered reappearance effort when third at Redcar last time; should be spot on now and, altough having first run at this venue, has each-way claims.

stable_tour.quote: I haven't done too much with my 2yos but this filly actually won first time out for us back in April. I don't usually have many youngsters out at that time of the year but she was showing a lot of speed and won well. Her next run at Pontefract was a different story as she was too keen and gave herself no chance, while at Redcar last time out she encountered good to firm ground for the first time and although she ran well, I felt she would appreciate a little more cut. We will look to upping her in trip to 6f next and find some slower ground. 26-07-23

runners.name: Northfield Lake
runners.breeder: S A S Haras Le Gue
runners.comment: Has shown ability but has yet to win; first run for yard but best watched after absence
runners.spotlight: Yet to win and hasn't run for nearly a year but showed ability over 6f-7f for Ralph Smith; down 5lb since last run but probably one to take on this time.

runners.name: Belsito
runners.comment: Better than the bare facts at Carlisle a week ago; claims if things slot into place
runners.spotlight: Overall record has an uneven look to it but he shaped better than the bare form (pulled hard) at Carlisle a week ago, his second run following wind surgery; risky but has claims if things slot into place.

runners.name: Dwindling Funds
runners.owner: D P Van Der Hoeven & D G Pryde
runners.comment: Well beaten on three of four runs but interesting Mulrennan rides in preference to Inanna
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on three of four starts but interesting Paul Mulrennan rides in preference to recent winner Inanna; improvement needed but worth keeping an eye on the market.

runners.name: Inanna
runners.comment: Knows how to win and bit better than bare form of last run; each-way prospect
runners.spotlight: Has won three times from 5f-7f since September, though didn't help herself with a slow start at Ayr last time (behind Sir Garfield); claims if things pan out more favourably.

quotes.race: Culcheth Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Inanna is a very nice filly. It was a nice fair track and we decided to send her up there because she had time to organiser herself. She could drop back, she is pretty versatile, but they didn't go much of a gallop. We like her at home and we will see how she comes out of the race. We have a nice bunch of horses, we have kept the numbers down, but hopefully the two-year-olds will be nice - Sean Woods, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She was very keen when we got her- she was trying to do it all in one breath. But she's done well, winning two of her last four races, ridden by Paul Mulrennan at Carlisle and then at Hamilton by Amie Waugh. She'll probably be kept going for a while as she goes on any ground. She normally runs over 5f or 6f and might stay 7f if she relaxes. She ran over 7f at Musselburgh last month but was a bit too keen and finished second. But she's going the right way and is starting to relax and enjoy her racing. 02-10-24

runners.name: Moyola
runners.comment: C&D winner nearly a year ago who is on a good mark and now gets first-time cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Dual AW winner who won over C&D nearly a year ago; now gets cheekpieces and should be better for last run (after a break and following wind surgery); can't rule out from handy mark.

runners.name: Ramon Di Loria
runners.comment: Bit better than he was able to show at Catterick but winless here in 12 attempts
runners.spotlight: Multiple turf/AW winner who is a bit better than he was able to show at Catterick last time (wide trip); yet to win at this venue in 12 attempts, though.

quotes.race: Foley's Bar & Off Licence Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Ramon Di Loria ran well at Dundalk. He is a good ground horse, Ronan gave him a lovely ride and I think he'll go forward from here - Tracey Collins, trainer.

runners.name: Jump The Gun
runners.comment: Down in the weights and shaped well on latest start at Ayr; another to consider
runners.spotlight: Hasn't won for some time but has sliipped a fair way in the weights and shaped as though coming to hand behind Ramon Di Loria at Ayr last time; has won at this venue and is shortlisted.

quotes.race: BetUK. Home Of The Acca-Fenwa Handicap
quotes.quote: Jump The Gun has been running okay, had a wind operation earlier this year and ran a good second at Doncaster in September, but has been disappointing since. He needs some cover and then weave his way through the field, but you couldn't have scripted it here better - Mike Dean, syndicate member, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Glendown
runners.comment: Hasn't been at best on four of last five starts and has a bit to prove for now
runners.spotlight: AW/multiple turf winner who hasn't been at best on four of last five starts and, although yard among the winners, this one has a bit to prove for now.

quotes.race: Brannans Have Done The 61 Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Glendown has done it quite nicely, he travelled well and picked up and just did enough to win. He ran a great race at Chester and I don't know what went wrong last time [at Hamilton] - he just ran all right. He's come here and shown he's in good form - Duran Fentiman, rider

stable_tour.quote: He won't be running until the middle of the season. There's nothing wrong with him, he was just a bit late back from his owners. He won three times over six furlongs last season, but he also ran well over five and I don't know which is his best trip. 23-04-24

runners.name: Iris Dancer
runners.comment: Course specialist who hasn't been at best on last five starts; dropped to a decent mark
runners.spotlight: Multiple C&D winner who hasn't been at best on last five starts; however, has dropped down the weights and is 9lb below last winning mark so will be well treated when she does come back to form.

quotes.race: Usave Business Energy Specialist Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: Iris Dancer goes halfway through the race then jacks in a little then she warms back up and you always know you'll get a run out of her in the end. She really enjoys that stiff finish, she gets into top flight just at the line. It'd be nice to find another race before the end of the year and see what we can do - Andrew Mullen, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: Usave Business Energy Specialist Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: I think the blinkers just made the difference for Iris Dancer. She's a game horse and always tries her best, and she'll be even better with softer ground - Tristran Davidson, trainer.

runners.name: Jannas Journey
runners.comment: Well beaten both outings in handicaps and has plenty to prove at present
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten both outings in handicaps and, although dropping back to sprinting, she has plenty to prove at present.

2:42.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.6)

runners.name: Impressor
runners.comment: Should be better for last week's reappearance run but of more interest if ground softens
runners.spotlight: Should be better for reappearance run following a seven-month break a week ago (will be 1lb lower in future) but all wins and best form have been with varying degrees of give in the ground; chance will increase if ground softens.

quotes.race: Sam Hall Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: In the middle of the summer Impressor had a couple of near misses, he nudged up a couple of pounds and then had a couple of poor efforts. We thought maybe his chance was gone, but he does like the ground and still seems quite well in himself - Phillip Makin, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Jaimie Kerr Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: Impressor is an in-form horse at the moment and Phil's horses are flying. This lad loves the ground. Before when he used to get caught on a wing like that he wouldn't really battle hard for you but he's turned a corner and he dug deep when needed - Shane Gray, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

quotes.race: British EBF Molson Coors Novice Stakes (Plus 10 Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Impressor has got loads of speed and I wouldn't be rushing to go over seven furlongs with him. He's in the Mill Reef at Newbury and that's a likely type of race to run him in - Marcus Tregoning, trainer.

runners.name: Stash The Cash
runners.owner: Hp Racing Stash The Cash & Ptr
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner but may need conditions to ease before he's seen to best effect
runners.spotlight: Won twice over C&D last September but another who may prefer conditions to ease; should be spot on after a couple of runs this season but best watched unless there's rain.

stable_tour.quote: He had a few little issues and was very hard to train last year, and he got himself handicapped because of that. But we've been really pleased with him this year and he won well at Catterick first time. 23-04-24

runners.name: Eternal Sunshine
runners.comment: Multiple winner who is in decent heart; claims, particularly if there's plenty of pace
runners.spotlight: Five-time sprint winner on a sound surface and, although running well, he was unable to peg back two more forwardly ridden rivals at Ayr last time; claims if the leaders go off quickly.

stable_tour.quote: She's had a really good season, winning five times. It was frustrating to get beat last time when she got hampered in the Ayr Bronze Cup. She's a homebred and we purposely let her mature. I still think there's improvement in her but we've decided that was enough for the season. Hopefully she'll come back off a nice mark next year and we'll look to follow in the footsteps of American Affair. 02-10-24

runners.name: Orbital Chime
runners.owner: Making Headway Racing, Cassie And Wilson

prev_owners.owner: Making Headway Racing And K Scott

runners.comment: Hasn't had much racing since 2022 success but seemed to find 5f too sharp here last week
runners.spotlight: Not had much racing since winning at Redcar (6f, heavy) in 2022; edging down the weights but seemed to find this trip (good) on the sharp side last week; will be 2lb lower in future.

runners.name: Parisiac
runners.comment: Returned to winning ways over C&D last week but is 3lb badly in under his penalty
runners.spotlight: Had slipped in the weights and returned to winning ways dropped to 5f when scoring narrowly over C&D last week; 3lb badly in under penalty but can't rule out.

quotes.race: MansionBet Proud To Support British Racing EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Parisiac was a bit keen early on but he finished the race really well. I gave him one backhander and he just went. I ride him everyday at home, he's a bit tricky but the boss gave me the opportunity to ride him and he showed his ability. He'll learn a lot from today - Gianluca Sanna, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's another I bought at the sales and he looks as though he could be quite nicely handicapped if you delve into his form. He appears to like a bit of soft ground and I hope the change of scenery might rekindle some of what he once had. I'm not sure he was suited by Hamilton on his first run for us and we may try him on a flat track. I'm sure he'll win races for us. He looks quick but sees 6f out well. 26-07-24

runners.name: Hurt You Never
runners.comment: Goes well here and closely matched with Parisiac on last week's C&D form; interesting
runners.spotlight: 2-3 at this venue, the defeat coming over C&D last week when fourth to Parisiac having missed the break (usually starts quickly); closely matched with that rival on these terms and could run well.

quotes.race: BetUK. It's Where The UK Bets Handicap
quotes.quote: She's a really game mare. I thought Hurt You Never might need the run but she showed she's in great form. Early on I thought I'd gone a bit quick but she just kept powering through - Mia Nicholls, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: She's been a superstar for us. She hasn't stopped winning and she's honest and tough. The soft ground wasn't ideal for her at Doncaster last week, but she was 4lb well in, so we gave it a go and she ran well to finish fourth behind Jojo Rabbit. She's easy to train and ride. She's won ten times and there'll come a point where the handicapper will have a say, but she'll be winning again. 26-07-24

runners.name: Betweenthesticks
runners.owner: J A Swinburne & Mrs Ruth A Carr
runners.comment: Decent strike-rate for in-form team and won at Catterick last time; respected up 4lb
runners.spotlight: Has won three of ten starts for his in-form trainer and back to winning ways at Catterick last time; up 4lb and back on a track with an uphill finish but may be capable of better.

stable_tour.quote: He's a straightforward sprinter who nearly always goes over the minimum trip. He had a busy time last year, running 12 times between May and October and winning twice. He doesn't want extremes of going and I fully expect him to win again soon. 09-04-25

runners.name: Willingly

prev_owners.owner: Lee Thompson, Katy Bird, Jacintha Hynes
Lee Thompson, Katy Bird, Jas Hynes

runners.comment: Had the run of the race when touched off at Chepstow last week and can't rule out
runners.spotlight: Had the run of the race when just touched off by a strong-finisher at Chepstow last week and, she's not without a chance, despite being 3lb out of the weights (due to go up that much from the weekend).

quotes.race: Follow Us On Twitter @leicesterraces Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Willingly loves this ground. She's fast out of the stalls and likes to bowl along. If the ground stays soft enough hopefully she can win again - Tyler Heard, jockey.

quotes.race: Quinnbet Casino Classified Stakes (Div I)
quotes.quote: That was my first ever ride at Yarmouth so it's great it was a winner. I rode Willingly last time at Salisbury and thought she had a race in her. There were a few fancied in it - Owen Lewis, rider.

2:12.race_name: Sodexo Live 2YO Series EBF Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Hamilton Park 2YO Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)
2:12.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.6)

runners.name: Alex Supreme
runners.comment: Ability at an ordinary level on debut a week ago; needs to step up a fair way to win this
runners.spotlight: Stable won this last year; ability at an ordinary level at Ripon on debut last week but, while open to improvement, she'll need a big jump forward if she's to win this.

runners.name: Blue Nguru
runners.comment: Shaped well when third to a well-regarded sort at Goodwood on debut; leading claims
runners.spotlight: Created a reasonable impression when third behind a well-regarded sort over this trip at Goodwood on debut last month; open to improvement and likely to go close.

runners.name: Impalaka
runners.comment: Cost £52,000 at the breeze-ups and is out of a 7f-1m1f winner; market should guide
runners.spotlight: Cost £52,000 at the breeze-ups and is out of a 7f-1m1f winner; stable has had a juvenile winner this season and market likely to be best guide to prospects on debut.

runners.name: Indigo Sierra
runners.comment: Speedy pedigree and, although yard not renowned for debut winners, is one to note
runners.spotlight: Cost £16,000 at the breeze-ups and is a half-sister to a 5f winner; trainer not renowned for debut winners in this grade but worth a look in the market.

runners.name: March Ahead
runners.comment: Half-sister to a useful 5f-6f winner; market should be a good guide to prospects on debut
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to useful 5f (2yo)/6f winner American Style and from a yard that gets plenty of debut winners; market should be a good guide to her prospects.

runners.name: Midnight Tango
runners.comment: From a stable in fine form and showed promise over this trip on debut at Newmarket; claims
runners.spotlight: From a stable in fine form and this one shaped well at Newmarket over this trip on debut; open to improvement and shortlisted.

5:17.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.6)

runners.name: Parish Record
runners.comment: Ex-Jim Bolger; cost 4,000gns last July; not shown a great deal since, but down in grade
runners.spotlight: Ex-Jim Bolger; bought for 4,000gns last July; not shown a great deal for Donald Whillans, but is down in the ratings and down in grade, so could make the frame.

runners.name: Straya
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And Partner
runners.comment: Ex-Irish; 16-race maiden; well handicapped; first run at beyond 1m2f (best form  at 1m)
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish; 16-race maiden; has become very well handicapped but has yet to run at beyond 1m2f and others are preferred.

runners.name: Arch Legend
runners.owner: S Thompson And Mrs R Carr
runners.comment: Two wins for Charlie Johnston; cost 14,000gns; good 2nd at Beverley last week; contender
runners.spotlight: Ex-Charlie Johnston; won at Windsor (1m3f, good) and Wolverhampton (1m4f, standard) last spring; bought for 14,000gns in January; best run for new connections when runner-up at Beverley last week (1m4f, good); interesting.

stable_tour.quote: He came here in February from Charlie Johnston's and I like the look of him. He's a tall, staying type, who has already done well physically and should mature a lot more. We don't have many stayers here, so he's a bit unusual. I'm finding out about him and looking forward to his first run, although he hasn't done any fast work yet. I'm not quite sure whatound will suit him best. He's an exciting addition to the stable. 09-04-25

runners.name: Krissy
runners.comment: Modest form for Lucinda Russell; needs to improve for change of yards and switch to h'caps
runners.spotlight: Modest form from 1m2f-1m4f in novice/maiden company for Lucinda Russell last season; needs to improve for the change yards and switch to handicaps.

runners.name: Fanaigi Linn
runners.comment: 0-19; creditable 6th at Wolves on first run after wind op; well beaten both starts since
runners.spotlight: 19-race maiden; ran creditably when sixth at Wolverhampton in November on first run after wind surgery, but has been well beaten since (1m6f/1m4f, AW/turf); hard to fancy.

runners.name: Sassy Glory
runners.owner: Ursa Major & Mark Walford Racing Club
runners.comment: 0-16; has run several good races (second at Thirsk last September) but lacks consistency
runners.spotlight: 0-16; has run several good races both on turf and the AW, notably when second at Thirsk last September (1m4f, good to soft); has an each-way chance, but lacks consistency.

runners.name: Hot Team
runners.owner: Pat Morris And Clear Cut Racing
runners.comment: Four-time winner over 1m1f here; not at his best so far this year; place chance
runners.spotlight: Has won four times over 1m1f here, the latest off a 6lb higher mark last June; not at his best on three runs this year and was beaten nearly 10l when seventh at Carlisle (1m3f, good to soft) last week; place chance.

quotes.race: Norfolk Park Norfolk Novice Median Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: I'm very pleased Hot Team as got his head in front as I thought he slightly threw it away at York last time. James was happy enough with him on ground that was quick enough. We very nearly didn't run and I think a lot of Zoffanys like a bit of cut in the ground. We'll probably wait now until we get soft in the going description or get genuinely good ground. He's got a handicap mark, but he could run in a novice with a penalty, or he could run in any race, including, if it got soft, the Acomb. I think he is smart enough and I think he'll be better in a better class of race. He travelled in his race at York and there like nothing would get near him and it's almost like he needs something to take him into the race. I think he's better than he's rated now, but on softer ground he could improve - Hugo Palmer, trainer.

runners.name: Pacos Pride
runners.comment: Ex-Roger Varian; 0-16 but placed seven times; fair reappearance run last month; a possible
runners.spotlight: Ex-Roger Varian; 16-race maiden but has been placed on seven occasions, including twice here last season (8.5f/1m1f); creditable run after a break when fifth at Catterick last month (1m4f, good to firm); a possible.

runners.name: Crystal Guard
runners.comment: 3-44; two fair runs last twice; good efforts over C&D on two occasions last term; chance
runners.spotlight: Strike-rate of 3-44 but not beaten far in handicaps at Wolverhampton (1m6f) and Ayr (1m5f, good) on last two starts; had two creditable efforts over C&D last season; chance.

stable_tour.quote: He stays well, he wins every year and he's always competitive in 0-60 staying handicaps. He outstayed them when he won over 1m5f at Hamilton and he goes well for Mohammed Tabti. The race developed on the other side from him there last week and he ran well enough. 26-07-24

runners.name: Lady Phoebe
runners.comment: 0-15; good fourth two runs back; sound effort on first start here; a possible
runners.spotlight: 15-race maiden on the Flat; creditable fourth at Catterick on reappearance (closely-matched with Paco's Pride) but lesser run last time; beaten a head when second on first run here (1m4f, soft); a possible.

runners.name: Aighear
runners.comment: 2-25 on the Flat; second over 2m1f last week (second over 1m4f here last term); a possible
runners.spotlight: Record of 2-25 on the Flat; sound run when second over 2m1f at Carlisle last week having finished runner-up over 1m4f here last August (soft); not out of it.

runners.name: Millbuie
runners.owner: N J Dalgarno & W R Ellis
runners.comment: 0-11; well beaten over 1m/8.5f on last two starts; no better when tried previously at 1m4f
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden; steps up markedly in trip after finishing well-beaten over 1m/8.5f on last two starts, although didn't appear to stay when tried at 1m4f; hard to fancy.

runners.name: Angelica Catalani
runners.comment: 0-10, although only three runs on turf; good 3rd at Ripon last July and chance on that run
runners.spotlight: 0-10, but having only fourth run on turf; would have a chance if reproducing her 3.5l third over 1m4f at Ripon last July (1m4f, good), although hasn't run as well since.

runners.name: Propagation
runners.comment: Longstanding maiden who makes no particular appeal on his first run since August 2024
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden who makes no particular appeal on his first run since August 2024.

runners.name: Sugarpiehoneybunch
runners.comment: Two wins on soft/heavy in April 2023; mainly disappointing since; others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Winner over 1m4f at Thirsk (soft) and Catterick (heavy) in April 2023; mainly disappointing since and perhaps best watched after a break.

runners.name: Dannick
runners.comment: 0-5 but he's run several promising races and could be dangerous on this drop back in trip
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden who has missed the break on a couple of occasions but he's run several promising races including when third on his Kempton reappearance (7f; first run since gelded) last month; ran into some trouble in that race and has possibilities if he's unfazed with this drop back in trip.

runners.name: Henry Tudor
runners.breeder: Whitsbury Manor Stud And Mrs M E Slade
runners.comment: 320,000gns yearling; been gelded and tongue-tie is applied but he needs watching in market
runners.spotlight: 320,000gns yearling; sixth foal; half-brother to winners Godhead (7f/1m including AW; RPR 97), Say Hello (6f 2yo; 88) and Picture Frame (7f 2yo; 82); dam Group-placed 6f 2yo winner (95), closely related to 6f/7f 2yo Listed winner Bibury Flyer; been gelded and tongue-tie is applied on debut but he needs watching in market.

runners.name: Keybaar
runners.comment: Promising third at Kempton in April and he should improve for that experience; interesting
runners.spotlight: 190,000gns half-brother to four winners; looked inexperienced when 11-2 at Kempton (6f, AW) in April but he made some late headway to finish third; that was a promising start behind some useful prospects and he should know much more this time; interesting contender.

runners.name: Lazzar
runners.comment: Has leading claims on his best form but was turned over at 2-5 at Brighton on Monday
runners.spotlight: Just about sets the standard on his close call at Kempton (6f, AW) in April but he was turned over at 2-5 in small field at Brighton (5.3f) on Monday; may have had some issues with that track but he has a bit to prove on this quick turnaround; cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Luminous Warrior
runners.comment: Tailed off in sole 2yo run and had wind/gelding operations since; best watched on return
runners.spotlight: Cost 80,000gns as a yearling but was a big price on Newmarket debut (7f, good) in November and he finished tailed off; had wind/gelding operations since and is best watched on his return.

runners.name: Man Of Steel
runners.comment: Never involved on Windsor debut last month and he needs major improvement
runners.spotlight: 50-1 and was never involved after a slow start on his Windsor debut (6f, good to firm) last month; should know more this time but he needs major improvement.

runners.name: Mister Sandman
runners.comment: Well held at massive prices in two runs at Kempton (7f) this spring; can only be watched
runners.spotlight: Well held at massive prices in two runs at Kempton (7f, AW) this spring, with RPRs in the 40s on both occasions.

runners.name: Rock N It
runners.comment: Tailed off in both starts and latest was at Newbury (7f) last month
runners.spotlight: Failed to beat a rival on Kempton debut (7f, AW) in October and was tailed off again over the same trip at Newbury (200-1) on his return last month.

runners.name: Shavkat
runners.comment: 100,000gns foal; yard 29% with 3yos here in recent years and he's an interesting newcomer
runners.spotlight: 100,000gns foal; third foal; gelded brother to 6f/6.5f winner Cold Case (including Group 3; RPR 113); dam 7f 2yo/1m AW winner (71), half-sister to 5f 2yo Group 3 winner Ponty Acclaim; yard 29% with 3yos here in recent years and he's an interesting newcomer.

runners.name: Estimaid
runners.owner: H J Jarvis & Mrs P Jarvis
runners.comment: Finished in rear in two runs at Kempton (7f) and minor handicaps will be more like it
runners.spotlight: Finished in rear at Kempton (7f) in sole 2yo run and same story over same C&D on her return in April; has lots to find here and minor handicaps will be more like it.

runners.name: Musical Angel
runners.comment: Has not gone on since her debut second at Ascot and has a bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Promising second on Ascot debut (6f, good) last July but she's taken two backward steps since and was only fifth of six on her Southwell reappearance (6-5 favourite) last month; still early days and now goes back up in trip but she needs to get back near her best.

runners.name: Mesaafi
runners.comment: Impressive at Chelmsford on Sunday; unpenalised and holds strong claims
runners.spotlight: He has done well since blinkers went on, winning at Newcastle in January (for Simon Pearce) and taking a big step forward when comprehensively seeing off 13 rivals in a competitive Chelmsford event on Sunday; escapes a penalty and has a lot in his favour.

runners.name: Rebel Empire
runners.comment: C&D win in December was one of 3 successes over the winter; quiet on turf latest
runners.spotlight: Won three handicaps around the turn of the year, one of them over C&D; not at his best at Ripon last time but returning to this surface should be beneficial; feasible mark still.

quotes.race: Bet Boost At bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: To be honest, I thought Rebel Empire had a really good chance. I was doing eight-four, which is light for me, but he's the ultimate pro. He's turned himself around in the last month and I'm really pleased for him as he's all heart - Joe Leavy, rider.

runners.name: Invincible Speed
runners.comment: C&D win in April has been followed by one good and one bad run on turf; needs career-best
runners.spotlight: Finished with a flourish to win a C&D handicap in April; solid run on turf next time but he ran poorly at Ascot last month; getting back on this surface could help but he will need a career-best to score.

runners.name: Batal Dubai
runners.comment: Good chance on this winter's best but needs to leave some quiet runs behind him
runners.spotlight: Now 2lb lower than when winning a 7f handicap here on New Year's Eve; also ran well at Southwell (6f) in February but his last three runs have been underwhelming; needs a full revival.

quotes.race: JenningsBet Festival Handicap
quotes.quote: I needed some luck, but I was on a really capable animal. It was a good bit of placing by Harry and Roger because Batal Dubai was in great form and improved from Windsor. I thought with a bit of luck we'd win the whole way. He went to the start sweetly and I didn't have to fight him at any stage. He's a horse with a future and the weight-for-age isn't massive, but it has helped him - Oisin Murphy, jockey.

runners.name: Mc Loven
runners.comment: On a dangerous mark but drawn widest and 6f has looked to stretch him in the past
runners.spotlight: Slipped to a handy mark and he's much better than his reappearance effort; 6f looks to stretch him though and he has the widest stall to contend with; this will probably not be his day.

quotes.race: At The Races App Market Movers Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: I was pretty impressed with Mc Loven and he's got a lot of pace. Epsom is Simon's local track and I'm sure he'll target those five-furlong races there next year, but this could be his playground. He doesn't know his job fully yet, but he's got gears - Paddy Bradley, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Maid In Chelsea
runners.comment: Career-best when second at Bath latest; 2lb higher in a better race; cheekpieces now tried
runners.spotlight: Lightly-raced filly who ran her best race so far when a neck second at Bath 13 days ago (5.7f, firm); 2lb higher and she'll need more for the addition of cheekpieces if she is to take this.

runners.name: Lady Wingalong
runners.comment: Flourished for this yard but up in class on the back of a rare modest effort last month
runners.spotlight: Has made giant strides for this stable, first past the post on six occasions (disqualified after the first); well held at Wolverhampton (7f) last month and suspicion she'll prove vulnerable once again.

runners.name: Count Otto
runners.comment: Conditions to suit & on lowly mark but this 10yo hasn't shone in two runs after an absence
runners.spotlight: Conditions to suit and he's on a good mark but this veteran has been well beaten in two runs since returning from a long absence and this looks a tough race in which to bounce back.

quotes.race: BetUK Over 40,000 Live Streamed Races Handicap
quotes.quote: Count Otto has been a legend for us. It's taken a couple of runs to get him back to himself after he had an injury last year, and I wasn't sure he was quite there yet, but it was great to see him win. He prefers a track with a turn so Lingfield suits him well. We'll look at the Sprint on Finals Day now and hopefully get him in the Stewards' Cup or consolation race at Goodwood in the summer - Amanda Perrett, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: Count Otto is very consistent and it's nice that he's come here and won after a good winter on the all-weather. He must have fast ground so we could look at the consolation race for the Stewards Cup which he's run in a few times - Amanda Perrett, trainer.

quotes.race: 32Red.com Handicap
quotes.quote: For a little horse who can panic in the stalls, Count Otto is going the right way. Craig and Gary Witheford have done a good job, and the hood helps. We'll consider Good Friday, but he's still got ground to make up on the top horses in the Sprint and there are some nice 3yo handicaps on turf - Amanda Perrett, trainer.

quotes.race: 32Red Casino Handicap
quotes.quote: Count Otto is a bonny little horse and we've got the stalls (issue) sorted out now, as he was good again today. He'll hopefully improve with racing - Mark Perrett, husband of trainer Amanda

runners.name: Tyger Bay
runners.comment: Third to Invincible Speed over C&D when last seen 65 days ago; eligible for weaker races
runners.spotlight: Third to Invincible Speed over C&D 65 days ago and dropped 1lb for his troubles; type to pop up soon but perhaps in a lower grade.

runners.name: Transparent
runners.comment: Lightly raced 3yo and he's 2-3 on AW; not ruled out back in this sphere
runners.spotlight: Two AW novice wins from first three starts (7f/1m) and again ran well when runner-up on handicap/turf debut at Newmarket (1m, good) in April; wasn't so good at Haydock last time but he still has potential and is not ruled out back on Polytrack.

runners.name: Gallant
runners.comment: Still unexposed and he had a nightmare with traffic issues at York latest; interesting
runners.spotlight: Won a Kempton novice (6f, AW) on the second of his two 2yo runs; held in three starts this spring but he had a nightmare with traffic issues in a 7f handicap at York (7-2 favourite) last time; now drops back in grade and he's an interesting contender on this step up to 1m.

runners.name: Hot Property
runners.comment: No joy in his three handicaps and has something to prove on this switch to AW
runners.spotlight: Bolted up in a Catterick maiden (7f, good to firm) last August, but he's finished down the field in three handicaps since including in two runs at Beverley this season; dropped another 2lb but he was well below form last time and has something to prove on this switch to AW.

runners.name: Troy Story
runners.comment: 0-5 but he may have needed his reappearance run and that was a tough task; in the mix
runners.spotlight: 0-5 but he went close on handicap debut at Kempton (7f, Polytrack) in November and may have needed his reappearance at Ascot (1m; first run since gelded) last month; that was behind a major improver and he's in the mix on this return to AW.

runners.name: Padua
runners.owner: P C J Dalby & R D Schuster
runners.comment: Went close over C&D in first of his three runs; needs close look on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Mixed form in three qualifying runs but he went very close over C&D on debut and his fifth at Kempton (1m2f) last month was a respectable effort behind some useful prospects; this is more realistic on handicap debut and he needs a close look back in trip; tongue-tie added.

stable_tour.quote: He nearly won first time out at Lingfield in November when sent off at 125-1, but then we ran him back a bit quickly afterwards. He ran a nice race on his seasonal return at Kempton in April behind Ernst Blofeld and we're now just waiting for the ground really. I've got rather too many three-year-olds rated in the high 70s who are still maidens - they've all been second and are very difficult to place in the current system. Ever since a novice system for three-year-olds came in it's been very difficult to place those who are in the 75-80 range. Normally you'd have won a maiden by then and been competitive in a handicap, but now they're novices you're taking on basically Group horses. If you come second or third that puts you up too high in the handicap and you're in the middle of nowhere. 29-05-25

runners.name: Lazieelunch
runners.breeder: The Pocock Family & Mr J Gunther
runners.comment: Triple AW winner but he's exposed now and needs to find more back at this trip
runners.spotlight: Three AW wins from his 11 starts (including over C&D), but he hasn't threatened back in this sphere in his two runs this season; made some late gains to finish third at Chelmsford (1m2f) last time but he needs to find more back at this trip.

quotes.race: Get Raceday Ready Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Lazieelunch won well at Kempton and the handicapper put him up 10lb, which we thought was a little bit harsh, but he keeps improving and quickened up really nicely off a strong pace - Sean Woods, trainer.

runners.name: Invincible Duke
runners.owner: Mrs Philip Snow, Ed Babington & Partner
runners.comment: Promising third on handicap debut at Goodwood and he's respected on this return to AW
runners.spotlight: Unexposed gelding who made a promising start in handicaps when a rallying third at Goodwood (1m, good; blinkers added) last month; didn't get much luck in that race and he should have more to offer on this return to AW; respected.

runners.name: Threatening
runners.comment: Went close under a penalty at Wolverhampton and he's open to more progress; key player
runners.spotlight: Justified support on handicap debut at Southwell (7f, Tapeta) in April and he went close under a penalty at Wolverhampton six days later; up another 3lb but he pulled clear with the winner last time and is open to more progress; key player.

runners.name: Star Legend
runners.comment: Has won three of his last four Flat starts and he's a big player again in hat-trick bid
runners.spotlight: Scored over hurdles in December and he's won three of his last four Flat starts (Polytrack/turf); had to work hard to cash in on a good opportunity at Catterick (1m6f) last week but he got the job done with a strong finish; has a penalty this time but he still looks feasibly treated and is a big player again back up in trip.

stable_tour.quote: He was quite a shock winner at Fakenham last time but he'd just dropped into a lower grade. He does really well around Fakenham, which is really nice as it's a track I love supporting. We've just set up a syndicate to sell him to more local people, which will mean he'll keep running at local tracks like Fakenham and Huntingdon. 01-01-25

runners.name: Poncho
runners.comment: C&D winner but he flopped at Ascot last time and needs to bounce back; one of two for yard
runners.spotlight: Hurdle winner who got off the mark on the Flat over C&D in December; couple of creditable thirds here since then but he flopped at Ascot (last of eight) last month and needs to bounce back after that 13l defeat; stablemate of Donald Llewellyn.

runners.name: Donald Llewellyn
runners.comment: Record of 4-11 on AW and was a creditable third at Kempton (2m) latest; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Relatively lightly raced 8yo who is versatile trip-wise and has record of 4-11 on AW; returned from a lengthy absence in February but he won here (1m5f) in March and bounced back from a poor run to finish third at Kempton (2m) last time; on same mark here and has claims if he can back that up; one of two runners for yard.

runners.name: Home And Dry
runners.comment: Sole win was in 2021 and has struggled under both codes in his last three runs; opposable
runners.spotlight: Just one win from 15 starts and that was in a four-runner race at Chelmsford (2m, AW) in 2021; well handicapped on old form but he's struggled in last two Flat runs and was tailed back over hurdles in February; cheekpieces now return but has lots to prove after another break.

runners.name: Dubai Harbour
runners.comment: Two wins here (1m2f) during the winter but has bit to prove on this step up to 2m
runners.spotlight: Had a productive time on Polytrack during the winter including two wins here (1m2f); only 2lb higher than for his last success but he's untried beyond 11.4f and not sure how he'll handle this new test over a staying trip; hard to weigh up after a short break and market should guide.

stable_tour.quote: This homebred colt is quite big but he has a lovely attitude, and I'd not be surprised if he turns out to be useful. We'll start off over 6f or 7f, but not until the second half of the season. 13-04-22

runners.name: Certain Style
runners.breeder: Whitsbury Manor Stud And Mrs M E Slade
runners.comment: Allowed huge advantage when winning over C&D in November; well held since
runners.spotlight: Made her breakthrough (16th attempt) in a C&D handicap in November, but was allowed to poach a huge advantage and she finished well held in her next three runs, including here on Tuesday.

quotes.race: Stay In Control With BetUK "Hands And Heels" Apprentice Handicap (Racing Excellence Initiative)
quotes.quote: I said to Tyrese if there was no pace to let Certain Style bowl along, but it was pretty diabolical from the riders in behind - Ian Mongan, assistant trainer.

4:25.race_name: Each Way Extra At bet365 Handicap

runners.name: Cill Mocheallog
runners.comment: Won 7f maiden in Ireland last year; out of sorts on AW but down in weights and grade
runners.spotlight: Won 7f maiden at Gowran in May 2024; out of sorts on the AW in Britain but he's eligible for a lower grade than of late which can only help; may yet need further weight off his back though.

runners.name: Thorntonledale Max
runners.comment: Dead-heated for 7f AW handicap in August; now 2lb lower; rocked between extremes since
runners.spotlight: Dead-heated for 7f handicap on Kempton AW in August and now 2lb lower, but he's rocked between extremes since and rejoins the fray after a break with a hood added.

stable_tour.quote: He's become quite famous since his run at Kempton the other day under Callum Shepherd when he dead-heated with Flavour Maker. He's a brother to City Of York and is another of ours who enjoys cut in the ground. He should be competitive in soft-ground handicaps over seven furlongs or a mile this autumn. 04-09-24

runners.name: My Mate Mike
runners.comment: Two C&D wins in 2024; back on song when 7f Chelmsford winner in April; good shot
runners.spotlight: Three AW wins in 2024 included two over C&D; a couple of hurdle runs didn't do much for him after being switched to this yard, but he was back on song when making all at Chelmsford (7f) in April and a Leicester run since was a stiffer test than ideal; should give it a good shot.

runners.name: Tea Sea
runners.comment: Three narrow Tapeta wins at 7f and 1m around the New Year; acts on Polytrack; considered
runners.spotlight: Three narrow wins at 7f and 1m on Tapeta around New Year and he didn't get any sort of run before finishing third on Kempton Polytrack (7f) in March; hasn't had many goes in 7f handicaps on this surface; considered.

runners.name: Touchwood
runners.comment: First C&D run since good win in 2023; O Murphy a rare booking for yard, 0-1 in last 5 yrs
runners.spotlight: Acts well over C&D but hasn't been back here since impressive win in 2023; on a handy mark and of interest after a good Leicester run in May, with Oisin Murphy a rare booking for the yard (0-1 in last five years).

stable_tour.quote: With his ability to act on the all-weather andass, he is an asset to the yard, his best distance being 7f. He will now go to Thirsk on Saturday for a 7f, 0-85 handicap. 09-04-25

runners.name: Jackson Street
runners.comment: Out of sorts for new yard but well treated on best 7f AW form last summer; cheekpieces off
runners.spotlight: Won over 6f for previous yard on Newcastle Tapeta in December but out of sorts in three runs for this one; the return to the AW will suit though and he's well treated on his best 7f form on sand last summer; usually wears cheekpieces but not today.

runners.name: Tronido
runners.comment: Won first 2 handicaps over 7f; back on latest winning mark; recent form not up to scratch
runners.spotlight: Won her first two 7f handicaps last June, over C&D and at Kempton, but the handicapper soon caught up; has returned to her latest winning mark but this year's form isn't up to scratch just yet.

runners.name: South Dakota Sioux
runners.comment: Consistent over the winter, winning twice at 7f including back from break; can be involved
runners.spotlight: Had a good spell over the winter, winning twice at 7f (the first time after a break) and ending that campaign with two more solid shows; can be involved back on Polytrack.

quotes.race: At The Races App Market Movers Handicap
quotes.quote: The idea was to get South Dakota Sioux out and get him relaxed and keep him settled. He was a little bit lit up still but raced the right way round today - Mark Winn, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Thoughtful Gift
runners.comment: Enters the argument on best C&D form; fair 4th on turf latest; competitive back here
runners.spotlight: Weights pull with My Mate Mike on C&D form last May; both with different stables now and she ran quite encouragingly on second start for this one at Leicester recently, when again without regular cheekpieces (all four wins in them) but perhaps she doesn't need them now; competitive back here.

runners.name: Mount Mogan
runners.comment: In good form over C&D, winning twice and solid 3rd behind subsequent winners latest
runners.spotlight: Had a run of moderate results in the second half of 2024 but he popped up in a C&D classified event in January and promptly followed up back in a handicap in March; solid form when third to subsequent winners over C&D in April and, off the same mark, he has less to prove than many.

quotes.race: Win £2,000,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap
quotes.quote: Mount Mogan has come a long way down the handicap and has got himself into this grade. We always thought he was slightly better and hopefully that gets his confidence back and we can have some fun in the winter with him - Laura Mongan, trainer.

quotes.race: MansionBet Beaten By A Head Handicap
quotes.quote: Laura Mongan thought Mount Mogan would run well and she was right. They got him in good condition from Ed Walker I believe and he finished off his race very well - Jim Crowley, jockey.

quotes.race: Abacus Securities Handicap
quotes.quote: They didn't go quick and Mount Mogan got a nice position. His victory last time has given him a bit of confidence and hopefully he's still on the up  Luke Morris, jockey.

quotes.race: Unibet Extra Place Offers Every Day Handicap
quotes.quote: Mount Mogan has always shown a lot in the mornings but hasn't really fulfilled his potential on the track. The ability is there and he got a lovely trip round today and did everything right. Hopefully it gives him a bit of confidence where he can step forward from it  - Luke Morris, rider.

runners.name: Okami
runners.comment: C&D winner off a way higher mark in 2023; minor form for new yard; return to 7f can suit
runners.spotlight: C&D winner off a way higher mark in September 2023 but he's yet to get into much of a rhythm for this yard; the return to 7f should help but Mount Mogan looks the yard's best option.

runners.name: Foro Romano
runners.comment: Two near misses for current stable; not at his best last time; yard runs two here
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden but he's gone close on a couple of occasions since joining Marco Botti, notably a short-head defeat at Kempton in March; not so good last time, however, and the stable also runs Blewburton.

runners.name: Midnight City
runners.comment: 7lb lower than when 3rd on handicap debut in February; no progress since
runners.spotlight: Ran well when third of ten at Southwell on his handicap debut in February and he's dropped 7lb since that effort; that is with some justification, as he's been well short of that level in three runs since; needs a full revival with cheekpieces the headgear of choice this time.

runners.name: Blewburton
runners.comment: Chased home Ballsgrove Boy four weeks ago; not sure to reverse the placings
runners.spotlight: Best effort for a while when chasing home Ballsgrove Boy at Kempton four weeks ago; slightly better off at the weights but looks more exposed than his old adversary.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: It's hard to know what he has beaten but Blewburton is a nice horse. He wants six furlongs but they went hard and it suited him. It can be tricky with a penalty and we may look at the Woodcote at Epsom - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

runners.name: Dutch Finale
runners.comment: Lost chance at the start on h'cap debut/2025 return; bred to be much better than this mark
runners.spotlight: Doubt his three runs as a 2yo scratched the surface of his ability (looked in need of the experience) and he lost all chance at the start on his handicap debut/reappearance at Nottingham four weeks ago; this well-bred 3yo remains of interest.

runners.name: Nacho Nacho Nacho
runners.comment: Promise in two of his three runs; moves into handicaps with the potential for better
runners.spotlight: Promise in two of his three maiden/novice runs this spring, most recently when keeping on for a never-dangerous fourth at Wolverhampton (5f) 17 days ago; moves into handicaps with the potential for better.

runners.name: March To The Band
runners.comment: Looks on a tough mark and was a distant 5th on recent handicap debut; more required
runners.spotlight: No improvement for the switch to handicaps when a distant fifth at Haydock two weeks ago; new blinkers and the return to AW the straws to clutch at.

runners.name: Sultan Of Oj
runners.comment: Unplaced in three runs for another yard last year but showed ability; check the betting
runners.spotlight: Big prices and well held in three sprint runs on turf for the Moores last summer; faces a more realistic assignment on his stable/handicap debut and his Windsor seventh on his second run offers hope this mark is in range; attracted support prior to missing his intended reappearance at Wolverhampton last month; interesting.

runners.name: Horus
runners.comment: C&D win on New Year's Eve; in and out in 2025 and has the widest stall to contend with
runners.spotlight: Ready C&D win on New Year's Eve and there have been some good efforts in defeat this year; flopped back on turf at Windsor in April and the widest stall isn't ideal back on AW.

runners.name: Spring
runners.owner: Thorpe, Henwood, Regan & Mrs J Blake
runners.comment: Not seen to best effect in either start this year; could still have mileage in her mark
runners.spotlight: 6f win at Brighton last September; not seen to best effect in either start this year (caught wide at Wolverhampton latest) and there could still be mileage in her mark.

runners.name: Ballsgrove Boy
runners.comment: Off the mark at Kempton latest; still has more to offer; leading contender
runners.spotlight: Building up a solid record in AW handicaps and he got off the mark in determined fashion at Kempton four weeks ago; the way he moved through that race offers hope of better and he's a key contender up 4lb.

runners.name: Flickas Girl
runners.comment: Not fulfilled early promise; ran okay over 5f on turf here on Tuesday when well positioned
runners.spotlight: Not delivered on her early promise and, although she ran okay on turf here on Tuesday, she was on the best part of the track; still has a point to prove over 6f.

stable_tour.quote: She was super impressive first time out at Wolverhampton. I was kicking myself after Bath as I shouldn't have run her there with a penalty and the track probably didn't suit her. The form of that race is unbelievable, though, as the winner [Betty Clover] has gone on to win the Marygate and the second [Englemere] has won twice since quite comfortably. She's a very honest filly who tries very hard, and just tries to do a little too much in the first half of a race. She was very good when second in the Lily Agnes as it looked a nice race. She's owned by a local guy from Wrexham, so she'll probably be campaigned around Chester and she looks tailormade for it. Six furlongs won't be a problem and there'll be plenty more days for her. The more experience she gets, the more she'll be able to mix it on different tracks. She could be one for the St Hugh Stakes at Newbury later on and she looks capable of picking up black type. 30-05-24

runners.name: Scarlet Otara
runners.comment: Triple hurdle winner but she's been out of sorts last twice; bit to prove on chase debut
runners.spotlight: Three good-ground wins over hurdles last June-November, latterly on handicap debut at Ascot (2m7f); should have a future over fences but she's been out of sorts in last two hurdle runs and has bit to prove after another short break; hood added.

quotes.race: Copybet Mares' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Scarlet O'Tara jumped brilliantly today and that's her third [GBR] bonus now. It's an amazing feeling. There aren't many places where you can hear the crowd and a big thanks to Richard and everyone at home - Luke Scott, jockey.

runners.name: Lady Jago
runners.comment: Made it 3-7 over fences when scoring at Ludlow; big player again back up in trip
runners.spotlight: All of her runs have been on good or slower ground; point/hurdle winner who made it 3-7 over fences when scoring with something in hand at Ludlow (2m4f, good) last month; that was a three-runner race but she's only 2lb higher here and is open to more progress back up in trip; big player.

stable_tour.quote: She won her maiden very well and has been second since to two nice horses. She'll go into handicaps, where she'll continue to pay her way, and she'll jump a fence in time. 12-11-24

runners.name: Harrys Hope
runners.comment: 3-5 over fences and still has scope for more progress; entered 7:40 Warwick on Wednesday
runners.spotlight: Won last October on first three chase starts (2m3f-2m6f, good/good to soft) and went close at Hereford (3m1f, good to soft) next time; flopped at Hereford in December but returned from break with fair second off lower hurdle mark last month; still has potential as a staying chaser and he's one to keep an eye on for in-form yard; entered 7:40 at Warwick on Wednesday.

runners.name: Police Academy
runners.comment: Triple hurdle winner but she's 0-5 over fences and still has stamina to prove at this trip
runners.spotlight: Triple hurdle winner who is 0-5 over fences; ran well to finish second in a chase handicap at Worcester (2m4f, good) last August but she's been well held in three subsequent runs; on dangerous mark back in this sphere but she still has stamina to prove at this trip and others are preferred.

runners.name: Lost Connections
runners.comment: Runner-up at Hereford in October and has claims if she can pick up where she left off
runners.spotlight: Just 1-13 over fences but she rallied well to finish runner-up off a similar mark at Hereford (2m5f, good) in October; returns for new yard but she has run well when fresh in the past and looks worth another try at this trip; in the mix with Sean Bowen booked.

4:00.race_name: Grace & Dotty Country Clothing Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Hell Red
runners.owner: N Banks, W Dodd & J May
runners.comment: Capable hurdler/chaser for Paul Nicholls; has been holding his own in hunter chases
runners.spotlight: Capable hurdler/chaser for Paul Nicholls; has been holding his own in hunter chases and he's still only an 8yo; may prefer longer trips these days.

quotes.race: Champion Hats Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Hell Red won't be seen to good effect until he can run on soft ground and he's a horse I've got in mind to aim at the Grade 1 Finale here over Christmas, but he'll obviously run somewhere before then. He's a proper horse - a chaser down the line who gallops and jumps - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was very impressive on his first run at Chepstow in October, when he hosed up by 12 lengths. He then pulled up at Cheltenham the following month and has had a breathing operation since. He's been given a mark of 134, which is fair. At one point he was leading the betting for the Triumph, and he could have a prep race at Wincanton next Saturday. 15-02-21

runners.name: Salley Gardens
runners.comment: Signed off for Olly Murphy with two good-ground wins; recently sold for £21,000
runners.spotlight: On a hat-trick after good-ground wins at Southwell and here; pulled clear with a subsequent winner the last time so a 5lb rise was warranted; recently sold out of Olly Murphy's yard for £21,000; Sean Bowen knows him well.

quotes.race: Try Racing TV For Free Now Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Salley Gardens is on an upward curve and did that nicely. He loved the ground and Katie gave him a lovely ride - Olly Murphy, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has done wonderfully well this season, winning three of his four races, the most recent at Fakenham in November. During that period his mark rose from 90 to 111, but he is still on the upgrade and should continue to do well. He is enjoying a midwinter break now but will be back in the spring and is another I am looking forward to sending out for novice chases. 26-01-22

runners.name: Hecouldbetheone
runners.comment: 0-2 over fences in late 2013; has another go after some competitive runs over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Below his best in two chases when with Chris Gordon and those were in late 2023; however, has another crack at this discipline after a fair run of efforts over hurdles and the return of cheekpieces (visored last three races) is no bad thing.

runners.name: Do Your Job
runners.comment: He's not as good as he was and now struggles for consistency
runners.spotlight: Made all for clearcut success at Wetherby (2m3f, good) in March but beaten fair and square the last twice; he's not as good as he was and now struggles for consistency.

quotes.race: racingtv.com Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Do Your Job has fallen a long way down the handicap. He had wind issues and problems, so it's nice to see him win again. He got a nice lead and the better ground helped - he was a very good horse on his day. Things haven't been straightforward, but it's nice to get him a win. He could win another race while the ground is quick - Charlie Longsdon, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Extra Places Every Day Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Do Your Job lost his confidence a bit so we dropped him in class and he's come good - Peter Scudamore, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Jewson Stan Mellor Memorial Novices' Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It is hard to know quite what to make of it but I'm really pleased with Do Your Job. I thought he jumped well enough and his jumping got better as he warmed up through the race. He hadn't had the cleanest run coming into today and I think he will come on a lot for it. I suppose in an ideal world we will look for something similar next time and if he is good enough then start to get a bit more excited around Christmas. Two miles is his trip - Michael Scudamore, trainer.

quotes.race: Betway Top Novices' Hurdle (Grade 1) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought Do Your Job would outrun his price and he's run an absolute blinder. For a second I thought I was going to win my first Grade 1, but he was beaten by a better horse on the day - Brendan Powell, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's one of Michael [Scudamore]'s charges and I thought he ran a good race in the Old Roan. We'll probably drop back to two miles now. He could run at Cheltenham next or at Newbury, and that drop in trip should be within his remit as he's a great jumper. 15-11-23

He is a real superstar for us and enjoyed a terrific campaign last season with novice chase wins at Warwick and Newcastle before going on to win the Grade 2 Future Champion Novices' Chase at Ayr on Scottish National day by five lengths. He enjoyed a nice break over the summer and I was keen to see how he would get on when he returned at Aintree last month. Everything was going nicely and according to Luca [Morgan] he was travelling beautifully and just getting into it when he made a howling mistake four out which put paid to his chances. It really knocked the stuffing out of him and Luca allowed him to come back in his own time. The most important thing is he has come back in one piece and seems none the worse for his exertions. I would love to step him up from 2m4f to 3m as he looks to me as if he is crying out for further. We have a couple of options, including a handicap at Ascot on Friday, although we may wait and give him an entry in the Rehearsal the following week. The handicapper dropped him a pound to 145 for his last run. I hope he can keep climbing the chasing ladder and contest some nice Grade races in the spring. He saves his best form for the spring and hopefully we can build on things over the winter and find another 10lb by then. 21-11-22

runners.name: No But I Will
runners.comment: Two good runs in this headgear combination; latest effort was too bad to be true
runners.spotlight: Fourth (2m7f) and a close second (2m) in his first two chases in this headgear combination and Sedgefield last time just wasn't his true form; could be dangerous if back on song.

stable_tour.quote: He did very well last season as he was a big baby and just struggled physically. He was a bit disappointing at Aintree on Sunday, but it was his first time in a handicap and he'll improve for the run. He's a 3m-plus chaser, who handles softer ground, and we'll go over fences now. 01-11-23

He's a nice youngster who won his point-to-point at Curraghmore by 30 lengths in the spring before joining us. He made his rules debut at Kelso last month over 2m6f when a close third. He stayed on the whole way up the straight and will be worth following , as he gains more experience. He ran last week at Haydock but never managed to get in a blow and the ground probably played a big part. There's plenty to come from him. 07-12-22

runners.name: Golden Ambition
runners.comment: Hurdling form much respected and the blinkers are back on for this chase debut
runners.spotlight: Followed two wins in handicap hurdles during the winter with a career-best second at Ascot and the blinkers worn on those occasions were absent when perhaps in need of the run at Fontwell three weeks ago; they're back on for this chase debut and he has to be respected; trip/ground fine.

2:30.race_name: Happy 60th Birthday Nigel Kirby Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Ernest Gray
runners.comment: Worcester winner last month and now 2-2 over hurdles when encountering good ground
runners.spotlight: Bumper/hurdle/chase winner; now 2-2 over hurdles when encountering good ground after taking care of a frustrating sort at Worcester (2m7f) a month ago; that was his first run after wind surgery and in cheekpieces; 4lb rise is fair.

quotes.race: Punchestown (C & G) Point-To-Point INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Ernest Gray responded well for pressure. I would have preferred to go for a point - he jumps well - but he showed a good attitude and he should do well in novice hurdles next season - Colin Bowe, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was very impressive when he won a bumper at Warwick in the spring but was then always in top gear on good ground at Aintree and was outpaced. He's schooling well over hurdles but definitely wants soft in the going description and may start over two and a half miles. We like him. 19-10-22

He was a bit hit and miss last season, he won well over fences at Doncaster then disappointed slightly. He's fresh after a good break and made a satisfactory return  over hurdles at Exeter and will continue down that route. He wants 3m. 07-11-24

runners.name: Pounding Poet
runners.owner: Hft Limted And P J King And Son
runners.comment: Off his reduced mark he staged a revival of sorts when a rallying third at Ayr
runners.spotlight: Just over two years ago he was second at the Aintree Grand National meeting off a 14lb higher mark and has been lightly raced in the meantime; staged a revival of sorts when a rallying third at Ayr (3m, good to soft) and that was his first run in this headgear combination; chance.

quotes.race: Village Hotels Handicap Hurdle (Premier Handicap) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was fantastic. Pounding Poet had a break to freshen up and was always being aimed here. We hoped he might win, but second is great. That might be it for him over hurdles. He's going chasing and we are very excited about that - Toni James, owner.

stable_tour.quote: Things haven't gone to plan with him over fences this term, so we're planning to go back over hurdles at Aintree on Boxing Day to try to boost his confidence. His schooling at home has been very good over fences, but he was possibly taken off his feet at Newbury last time and his jumping fell apart after a mistake at the water, where he probably gave himself a bit of a fright. Aintree will be a good place to go back to as he's tended to run well there in the past. 20-12-23

runners.name: Roger Pol
runners.comment: Last season's chase win came off this mark and he is a maiden winner over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Following wind surgery, he had made a good start over fences only to be let down by his jumping and pull up at Kempton in February; his first win in that discipline came off this mark and he is a maiden winner over hurdles.

quotes.race: Get The Best Odds At Oddschecker Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Roger Pol has won two bumpers now and the plan would be to put him away now for a hurdling campaign in the autumn. He's not very big but makes up in heart what he lacks in stature - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

quotes.race: Cazoo Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Roger Pol is a lovely horse and we trained his brother Adrrastos who won seven races. What he lacks in size he makes up for in heart and ability. He jumps like an absolute bunny and should have a really nice future - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won on his chasing debut at Southwell last month when jumping neatly and accurately. He can continue to progress over fences. 06-11-24

He's lovely, a really cool horse who won two bumpers and was third with a penalty in one as well. He's a cracking jumper and one to look forward to for novice hurdles, but he's far from my only hope in that division. He's got to be exciting. 28-09-23

runners.name: Party Business
runners.comment: Has ground to make up with Ernest Gray on their recent Worcester clash
runners.spotlight: Continues to fall in the weights but stuck on a losing run and has ground to make up with Ernest Gray on their recent Worcester clash.

quotes.race: EFT Construction Handicap Hurdle (Grade 3) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was anxious watching Party Business early on. He just didn't travel, I presume it was a lot to do with the trouble he got into at Cheltenham - he's going to remember that as he was nearly brought down twice. He didn't pick up the bridle, he didn't travel and he didn't jump and he was obliged to go very wide turning for home. I'd said to Charlie 'if you get the opportunity, don't take it up before the last' and three out we were in front and I thought it was going to be a long way but he was tough. He fell in the Challow when he was going so well and nearly getting brought down at Cheltenham was very tough for him but he was a well-handicapped horse and he's shown that today. We'll go chasing with him next season. He's bred to be a chaser so let's get on and do that - Ian Williams, trainer.

quotes.race: Howden Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I thought that was an impressive performance. Party Business is a quality horse but you never know when you're running against the big yards what might be in there. I think the form should stand up and long term I had thought the EBF Final at Sandown would be an option for him, although we've probably blown our mark now. I think he'll stay further - Ian Williams, trainer.

2:00.race_name: Jack Frost Chiller & Freezer Hire Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Deep Purple
runners.comment: Point/bumper/maiden winner who wasn't beaten far in a small field on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Point/bumper/maiden winner who finished last of the four runners on his handicap debut at Warwick (2m5f, good) but wasn't beaten far at all; won his maiden over this longer trip; good chance.

stable_tour.quote: He won a bumper in the autumn and ran well enough on his first hurdles start at Ludlow, softening himself up by chasing the odds-on winner. I think he wants slightly slower ground. 12-11-24

runners.name: El Galactico
runners.comment: Kept the favourite honest at Fontwell and the winner had been third in a Listed bumper
runners.spotlight: Made an encouraging start at Fontwell (2m5f, good) as the odds-on winner he kept honest was previously third in a Listed bumper; entitled to build on that and have some say here.

runners.name: Miss Goldfire
runners.owner: Harry Fry Racing Syndicate Miss Goldfire
runners.comment: Had been looking a shade exposed but now seeks a hat-trick after two clearcut wins
runners.spotlight: Had been looking a shade exposed but now seeks a hat-trick after clearcut wins in a Fontwell novice (2m5f) and a C&D handicap (again on good ground); still rated some 8lb inferior to Deep Purple but she's receiving 7lb from that rival and Ciaran O'Shea rides again claiming 7lb; clear claims.

stable_tour.quote: She won on her debut at Wetherby and showed a really good attitude. She could run in the Listed mares' bumper at Cheltenham in November as she's only four and she'd have to run under a penalty in a normal bumper. We could look at all those black-type bumpers this season and I'm not in a hurry to go over hurdles with her. She seems to have progressed over the summer. 04-10-23

runners.name: Soldier At Arms
runners.comment: Has the weakest form claims of the four after finishing well held in a Sedgefield maiden
runners.spotlight: Has the weakest form claims of the four runners after finishing well held in a Sedgefield maiden (2m4f, good; 14-1).

stable_tour.quote: He's a brother to Willie Mullins' dual bumper winner Ballygunner Castle, but he's unraced as he got injured as a four-year-old and missed 18 months. He's back in work now and looks smart. 16-10-24

3:30.race_name: Greenthumb Grass Is Greener Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Baltray
runners.comment: Was going well when departing three out at Fontwell in April; couldn't rule out
runners.spotlight: Lengthy breaks a feature in his profile since winning a maiden hurdle in late 2023 (2m3f, good); pulled up on chase debut in October and has fallen the last twice over hurdles, though was going well when departing three out at Fontwell in April; couldn't rule out.

stable_tour.quote: He was a bit light when he first arrived from Ireland so we gave him plenty of time and he showed the benefit of that when running a lovely race on his debut over hurdles at Fontwell. He didn't have to improve much to win at Hereford, which he did comfortably, and 112 is a tempting mark to go and run him in a handicap now. Ultimately I think he'd prefer a bit more cut in the ground and he'll jump a fence in time. 22-11-23

runners.name: Lipa K

prev_owners.owner: P L Conway & T B P Cottrell Racing

runners.comment: Solid run in defeat last time at Bangor (2m, good) and returning to further should suit
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner whose four wins over jumps have been divided between hurdles and fences; ran a solid race in defeat in this discipline last time at Bangor (2m, good) and returning to further should suit.

quotes.race: Dragonbet Best Odds Guaranteed Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Lipa K always ran well for his previous yard and we were lucky to get him pretty much ready to go. He jumped really well at home and while he was a little ponderous over his fences today I don't think he enjoyed the soft patches of ground. He actually did it a shade cosily at the end - Oliver Greenall, joint trainer.

quotes.race: Killarney Oils (Pro/Am) Flat Race
quotes.quote: Lipa K is a good horse and I think he will be sold now, but hopefully to stay in the yard. I'd love to keep a horse like him in my yard - Eoin McCarthy, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's been a tricky horse to get right. He ran well when third at Stratford on his reappearance but it didn't help him when they took the hurdles out on the straight due to the low sun. I think there's plenty of room off his mark and he can win a decent race off a low weight. He wants a quickly run two miles with some cut in the ground, although he might stay a bit further. 02-11-23

runners.name: Windsurfer
runners.comment: Course winner but hasn't been shaping like a winner waiting to happen in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Won a 2m novice here in October but hasn't been shaping like a winner waiting to happen in handicaps; others preferred.

quotes.race: British EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Windsurfer will probably run in another novice under a penalty but he's a chaser really - Ben Case, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Gilbertina
runners.comment: Exposed hurdler but twice placed (2m4f/2m5f) before going in too deep in a Class 2
runners.spotlight: Exposed hurdler but twice placed (2m4f/2m5f) before going in too deep in a Class 2 at Cheltenham in April; capable of going well in a first-time tongue-tie.

runners.name: Clondaw Royale
runners.comment: Best form has been on slower ground; tailed off the last twice on good
runners.spotlight: Both wins and best form have been on slower ground, and he finished tailed off the last twice on good; needs the forecast showers to be heavy ones.

quotes.race: Thank You John Burgess Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Clondaw Royale is a really nice horse and I'm delighted to get that win with him. The further he went, the better he got. Hopefully, he'll be a nice stayer in the future - James Smith, jockey.

runners.name: Golden Identity
runners.comment: Doesn't look on a strikingly good mark for today's handicap debut but he's up in distance
runners.spotlight: Lengthy breaks have preceded his last three races and was beaten 14l, 43l and 19l; doesn't look on a strikingly good mark for today's handicap debut but he's bred for this longer trip and that could trigger improvement.

stable_tour.quote: He's out of a mare I trained who was fourth behind Quevega in the Mares' Hurdle at the 2014 Cheltenham Festival and he was fourth in a bumper last time. He's had niggly issues through the winter, but we need to learn more about him. He's young and green but works well, so we've got something to look forward to over hurdles next time. 20-03-24

runners.name: Ikigai Star
runners.comment: 3lb rise for Huntingdon win looks very fair considering what the second has achieved since
runners.spotlight: Dual 2m winner who proved his stamina for this far with a battling success at Huntingdon (good); the runner-up had won before and twice since, so a 3lb rise looks very favourable.

runners.name: Ghasham
runners.breeder: A O'Brien,M Al Monsour& K Al' Attiyah
runners.comment: Competitive off this sort of mark during the winter and Sean Bowen is booked
runners.spotlight: Down the field in 2m AW handicap last week but he was competitive off this sort of mark during the winter and booking Sean Bowen is a statement of intent; should go well, for all that slower ground would be preferred.

quotes.race: Follow Us On Social Media Maiden
quotes.quote: Ghasham is a massive big horse and looks progressive. It was a nice performance and there is a lot of improvement to come from him. He loved that ground and was very tough - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Russian Virtue
runners.comment: Not won for a while but in fair form this spring; conditions suit and each-way chance
runners.spotlight: Last win was a two-runner handicap off a 9lb higher mark at Carlisle in December 2023 (2m1f, good to soft; started at 2-5); plenty of decent form since, including on last four runs over hurdles; conditions suit; each-way chance.

quotes.race: Top Odds Every Day With BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: They put this extra meeting on and Russian Virtue has been a bit unlucky for us on the Flat, being placed plenty of times. So while the weather is not great for going hurdling we thought we'd give him a spin on the Flat and it's great that he's won a third race in a row. I hope he'll be one for the two-mile hurdle at the Northern Lights finals at Musselburgh. He may run at Sedgefield on Sunday and get him qualified - Rebecca Menzies, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A fun dual-purpose horse who's won eight times for us, with six coming over hurdles and two on the Flat. He thrives on racing and his work at home, and he hasn't finished winning yet. We're keen to keep his mark similar to where it is now so he has a nice weight for the Go North two-mile hurdle series final, which he finished fourth in last year. He'll be lightly raced before that and we might even go back on the all-weather. 24-01-24

runners.name: Reel Rosie
runners.comment: Had five runs over jumps, winning at Sedgefield on second occasion; below par last twice
runners.spotlight: Has had just five runs over jumps, winning a Sedgefield maiden hurdle over 2m4f in November (good); sound run when third over this sort of trip at Catterick next time but well beaten on handicap debut and on the Flat since; a bit to prove now.

stable_tour.quote: She won a mares' novice hurdle at Sedgefield in mid-November and we're looking to find a similar race in the next two weeks, in which she can maybe defy a penalty and then go down the handicap route. She's owned by a great little syndicate and hopefully she's lucky for them. Her best trip appears to be 2m4f. 05-12-24

runners.name: Junior Des Bordes
runners.breeder: Earl Les Bordes De Mornay & G Hanquiez
runners.comment: Ex-Nigel Twiston-Davies; back after long break; interesting on stable/handicap debut
