runners.spotlight: In the frame on both previous starts over hurdles when with Nigel Twiston-Davies, best run when third in a Ffos Las novice on debut in November 2022 (2m, good); has a 927-day absence to overcome and not obviously well handicapped, but stable going well and wouldn't rule out.

runners.name: Broken Bond
runners.comment: Fair form in Ireland (best run at 2m4f); bit to prove on stable debut after 629 days off
runners.spotlight: Showed fair form over hurdles for Conor O'Dwyer in Ireland, best run when third of 13 in a Punchestown maiden on debut (2m4f, soft/heavy); didn't progress, although fair fifth in headgear in a Ballinrobe handicap on final start in September 2023 (2m6f, good); off since, and perhaps best watched down in trip on stable debut; tongue-tie tried.

runners.name: Scintillante
runners.comment: AW Flat winner; off the mark over hurdles at Worcester last time; chance off 4lb higher
runners.spotlight: AW Flat winner who got off the mark on 12th run over hurdles at Worcester (2m, good) 13 days ago; obvious contender off 4lb higher mark here.

runners.name: Ambassador
runners.comment: Four-time C&D winner; not at his best this year but well treated now and one to consider
runners.spotlight: Four-time C&D winner, latest win coming off a 9lb higher mark in July 2024 (good); hasn't run up to his best in four starts this year but on a good mark now; no surprise if he were to stage a revival.

quotes.race: Brit Direct Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Ambassador came to us in good form and all we've had to do is tick him over. He was given a good ride by Brian Hughes and it just sort of fell right for us really - Micky Hammond, trainer.

runners.name: Black Tonic
runners.comment: Ex-Irish; 0-11 under rules and not shown much for new yard; plenty to prove at present
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish; yet to win in 11 runs under rules and hasn't shown much in his two outings for this yard; plenty to prove at present.

runners.name: Cawthorne Cracker
runners.comment: Two wins on good going last season; cheekpieces now tried; each-way chance
runners.spotlight: Won handicaps at Stratford (2m2f, good) and Sedgefield (2m1f, good) last season; fair third after a break at Sedgefield in April (2m1f, good) but not so good last time; cheekpieces now tried; place chance.

runners.name: Penna Rossa

prev_owners.owner: R Allen, Blythe Hill Racing2, The Crowd

runners.comment: 1-18; fair third two runs back but well beaten after a break on stable debut last time
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-18 over hurdles; fair third at Ffos Las in January (2m4f, soft) but well beaten over same trip here after a break on stable debut last time; blinkers and tongue-tie back on (no improvement last time he wore them); others stronger.

quotes.race: Pinsent Masons Introductory Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We followed Penna Rossa on the Flat because he was Jeff Kidder's half-brother. We took note and got him for 5,000GBP. We always knew he'd be a changed horse over hurdles and he jumped superbly. I was satisfied with his run at Fontwell and decided to come here, not far from home - Camilla Poulton, trainer.

runners.name: Crystal Mer
runners.comment: Ex-Paul Webber; maiden; good third in a Plumpton h'cap in May 2024; not run since; chance
runners.spotlight: Ex-Paul Webber; 0-6 over hurdles but creditable third in a Plumpton handicap (2m, good) in May last year when last seen out; chance off 4lb lower on stable debut.

runners.name: Whyzzat
runners.breeder: New England Stud & Mount Coote Stud

prev_owners.owner: W J and T C O Gredley

runners.comment: Ex-Irish; maiden hurdle winner in 2021; mainly disappointing since; hood tried; 10lb wrong
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish; won a maiden hurdle at Roscommon in August 2021 (1m7f, good to yielding); mainly disappointing since and has a tough task from 10lb out of the handicap; hood now tried.

4:33.race_name: Quinnbet Best Odds Guaranteed Mares' Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Auntie Maggie
runners.comment: Penalised for Saturday when she made all for a comfortable success at Stratford
runners.spotlight: Has made all to win two of her last three races, the latest at Stratford on Saturday when she remained well on top late on; has a penalty but she's on top of her game right now and could be tough to reel in if granted any freedom up front.

runners.name: Milajess

prev_owners.owner: Exors of the Late Nicholas Kelly

runners.comment: In form and has a hefty swing in the weights with Auntie Maggie on their Fakenham clash
runners.spotlight: Beat last weekend's winner Tara Iti at Sedgefield in April (2m1f, good); similar form in finishing second the last twice and although some 13l behind Auntie Maggie in her penultimate race, she has a hefty swing in the weights with that rival; regularly partnered by Joshua Thompson.

runners.name: Granny B
runners.comment: 0-9 over hurdles but has produced good efforts in defeat here the last twice
runners.spotlight: Flat winner who is 0-9 over hurdles but has produced good efforts in defeat here the last twice, running on well from off the pace; in the mix.

quotes.race: Celebrating The Life Of Eric Armstrong Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought Granny B would run well. She's a bit sensitive to noise so I put the hood on and it seemed to do the trick. I've had her for about a month, I claimed her at Wolverhampton and she only cost 5,000GBP. She's a nice filly and she's got a bit more maturing to do. We'll have a bit of fun with her - Michael Mullineaux, trainer.

runners.name: Shes Got Bottle

prev_owners.owner: Gordon Bulloch & S Hardcastle D Szepler

runners.comment: Tailed off in her three qualifying runs but had a wind op and Flat exploits are respected
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in her three qualifying runs and has a lot to prove on this handicap debut, but she has had wind surgery and her Flat exploits need respecting (five-time winner at up to 1m2f).

stable_tour.quote: She's a bit of a Beverley specialist. The ground is key to her, she loves it soft. She wants a stiff finish, so will be aimed at races at Pontefract and Beverley, and Hamilton would also suit her. This year she seems to be bigger and stronger and seems to have improved a lot. We haven't got a specific target in mind but the next few weeks are set to be quite dry, so we might just leave her for a bit. 21-06-24

runners.name: Bluebella
runners.comment: One of the favourites on recent stable debut but was on the retreat when departing
runners.spotlight: Only won the once and that was over two years ago, over 2m on good ground off 3lb lower; one of the favourites for recent stable debut at Ffos Las but was beaten when departing late on; that run was after a break and she could be sharper all round this time.

runners.name: Blossom Tea
runners.comment: Hard to make a case for even off this low a mark given how she's performed in minor races
runners.spotlight: Hard to make a case for even off this low a mark given how she's performed in minor races, but handicap newcomers from this yard are never dismissed easily; all runs so far on good to soft; watch the betting.

4:20.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Maiden

runners.name: Lady Dora Mae
runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.comment: Dam 1m2f/1m4f winner, sister to French 1m1f Group 3 winner Mrs Fitzherbert
runners.spotlight: 68,000gns yearling; second foal; dam 1m2f/1m4f winner, sister to French 1m1f Group 3 winner Mrs Fitzherbert, half-sister to winners Do It All (UAE 1m Group 2) and Tales Of Grimm (Australian 1m Listed);

runners.name: Little Sure Shot
runners.comment: Half-sister to three winners, dam Lady Wingshot a Group 3 winner for Jim Bolger
runners.spotlight: E35,000 foal; eighth foal; half-sister to three winners; dam Lady Wingshot a Group 3 winner for Jim Bolger, closely related to 5f Listed winner Bahama Mama; third in recent Naas barrier trial.

runners.name: Minerva
runners.comment: 1,500,000gns yearling, sister to a winner, closely related to 1m Group 3 winner History
runners.spotlight: 1,500,000gns yearling; fourth foal; Frankel filly is a sister to 1m2f winner Propose (RPR 91), closely related to 1m course Group 3 winner History; dam won four stakes races, sister to 1m Group 1 winner Mohaather; Ryan Moore prefers to Moments Of Joy,

runners.name: Moments Of Joy
runners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith
runners.comment: Half-sister by Justify to four winners, dam a Group-placed winner by Galileo
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; half-sister by Justify to four winners, including six-time scorer United Front and  Ferretti who won for this stable and later in France; dam a Group-placed winner by Galileo; Ryan Moore on Minerva.

runners.name: Parallax
runners.comment: Ran green on debut at Dundalk, still looked raw when beaten 10l in fourth at Roscommon
runners.spotlight: Ran green on debut in a 5f Dundalk event won by the talented Lady Imam; still looked raw when beaten 10l in fourth at Roscommon.

runners.name: Quinns Charm
runners.comment: Suffered interference on debut at Navan when beaten almost 20l in eighth; tough task here.
runners.spotlight: Suffered interference on debut at Navan when beaten almost 20l in eighth; tough task here.

runners.name: Stairiuil
runners.comment: Started slowly and betrayed inexperience when 33-1 chance on debut at Roscommon
runners.spotlight: Started slowly and betrayed inexperience when 33-1 chance on debut at Roscommon

runners.name: Thenandnow
runners.comment: Half-sister to a 7f winner, dam Albigna won the 2019 Prix Marcel Boussac for the stable
runners.spotlight: Second foal; half-sister to 7f juvenile winner Attack; dam Albigna won the 2019 Prix Marcel Boussac for the stable, half-sister to 6f Listed winner Polybius, out of French Group 2 winner from the family of BC Mile winner Domedriver; yard's 2025 form is a concern.

4:50.race_name: Leopardstown Golf & Driving Range Apprentice Handicap

runners.name: Blues Emperor
runners.owner: Mrs H M Keaveney & Mark Keaveney

prev_owners.owner: Mrs H M Keaveney & M Keaveney

runners.comment: Entitled to come on for recent comeback run but this trip on the short side
runners.spotlight: Four wins all at 1m, notably Curragh premier event in 2023; last of 18 in similar contest on last month's seasonal return when plenty keen; entitled to come on for that but this trip on the short side.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Derby Festival Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Blues Emperor is very brave and when he gets his head in front he is hard to get past.

quotes.race: Tote Always SP Or Better Handicap
quotes.quote: Blues Emperor is a bonny little horse. We wondered would he handle this better ground but he is very tough and genuine. Hopefully he will make into a Premier Handicap horse - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

quotes.race: MAC Fuels & General Supplies Maiden
quotes.quote: Blues Emperor has probably done nothing but improve. He ran well at Dundalk and very well at Cork the last day. Ben (Coen) said he got into a pocket but he's very genuine, he tried his hardest when he got into the gap. We'll probably give him one more outing this season - Johnny Murtagh, trainer.

runners.name: Love Billy Boy

prev_owners.owner: Roldvale Ltd, C Bloor, W Salthouse

runners.comment: Naas win franked since; remains of interest off this mark
runners.spotlight: Two wins for Richard Hannon included over this trip at Chester; in good form over 6f this term for current yard, touched off at the Curragh and latest when responding well for pressure to get up late at Naas (second won next time); remains of interest off this mark.

runners.name: Fort Vega
runners.breeder: S A S U Ecurie Des Monceaux Et Al
runners.comment: Limerick second puts him in the mix and handles good ground
runners.spotlight: Useful 2023 form but down the field in Irish Cambridgeshire on only 2024 start; steadily working his way into form this term, notably latest when close second to an all-the-way winner over this trip at Limerick; form this term on soft but has winning form on good.

quotes.race: Royal Ascot Trials At Naas Handicap
quotes.quote: Fort Vega was a doubt on the quicker ground but we decided to let him take his chance because it was such a good race for him. He's in the Irish 2,000 Guineas, we might think about the Jersey Stakes - Sheila Lavery, trainer

quotes.race: Golf At Gowran Park Maiden
quotes.quote: Fort Vega is a really nice colt and still needed that run. A mile on that ground should be perfect for him. He has some smart entries but we won't lose the run of ourselves - Sheila Lavery, trainer

runners.name: Transcending Glory
runners.owner: Kildare Racing Syndicate & Kilmichael Racing Syndicate

prev_owners.owner: Kildare Racing Syndicate & Kilmichael Racing Syndicate

runners.comment: C&D winner last summer but plenty to find on recent form
runners.spotlight: Front-runner won over C&D last summer off 89; two runs this term way below best however so bit to prove now although handicapper giving him a chance and a return to forcing tactics could see improvement.

runners.name: Zabriskie Point
runners.owner: Ms H Mcguinness/Martin W White/Declan Sheridan/Breen White
runners.comment: Ex Charlie Hills-trained 4yo; on a workable mark, market interesting on yard debut
runners.spotlight: 52,000gns buy out Charlie Hills' yard last autumn, having won twice at two but had a light 3yo campaign, notably not beaten far in a couple of valuable handicaps; soft ground probably against him final start; on a workable mark and rider's claim a positive; market will be interesting.

quotes.race: British EBF 40th Anniversary Novice Stakes (Sire And Dam Restricted Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The ground was a big unknown for Zabriskie Point. He was up another furlong in trip as well. It was testing out there and I'd say he put up with it rather than relished it. He's probably better on faster ground - William Buick, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He won twice as a juvenile and wasn't disgraced when we stepped him up for a Group 3 at Newmarket. He's a bonny horse, but he has grown from two to three and enjoys his job, so hopefully we can have some fun with him. 17-04-24

After he'd shown a lot of speed at home, I felt he'd be a serious player on his debut at Leicester and he ended up winning nicely. His work since has been pleasing and he's got an entry for a valuable race at Doncaster in September already. 21-06-23

runners.name: Exquisite Acclaim
runners.owner: Thomas J Oconnor & Ms Hazel Mcguinness
runners.comment: Well held both starts this term at 1m, drop back in trip to suit but others preferred
runners.spotlight: AW specialist whose sole turf win came at Gowran (7f, good-to-firm) last summer; well held both starts this term at 1m, drop back in trip to suit but others preferred.

quotes.race: Group Deals Available At Dundalk Stadium Rated Race
quotes.quote: Exquisite Acclaim travelled everywhere, was half-idling with me up the straight and I brought him over towards the rail. Once he did that he ran through the line well - Jamie Powell, jockey.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Acca Freeze Handicap
quotes.quote: Exquisite Acclaim has come back down now and he has got confidence. He's tough and he's hardy, and he's really putting his head down. He has a bit of class to him - Ado McGuinness, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Median Sires Series Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Exquisite Acclaim was good. He was giving weight to all rivals and still picked them up well. We've always held him in high regard at home and didn't think he'd have to wait until now to win his maiden, but he could be a nice progressive three-year-old next year - Shane Foley, rider.

stable_tour.quote: I was very pleased with him when fourth in the 2,000 Guineas Trial at Leopardstown. He might not be a top horse but is going the right way and could well be a nice Listed type. 14-04-22

runners.name: Catch The Paddy
runners.comment: Primarily an AW performer of late, recent turf run leaves him with plenty to find
runners.spotlight: Mainly campaigned on AW since joining yard, winning on debut in December but not since, tame effort on turf at Musselburgh latest; opposable.

quotes.race: Sky Bet In Running Racing Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Catch The Paddy has got a great attitude, he's so laid back. He's got a big frame and he's still got a long way to go, he'll be a nice horse next year - Adam Ryan, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: As long as it's not very soft, we'll start him off over 7f at the Craven meeting, but he gets a mile no issue. He's wintered well and we feel we may have underachieved a little bit with him last season, so hopefully he's in for a good campaign. We still haven't got to the bottom of him and he's entitled to be competitive in those good handicaps at the festivals. 04-04-24

runners.name: Shoot To Kill
runners.comment: Successful turf return at Roscommon; has to be on the shortlist with conditions to suit
runners.spotlight: Seven of his eleven wins have been on the AW but winning turf return over this trip at Roscommon last month despite not getting a clear run; has to be on the shortlist again.

quotes.race: DKITSU Race Day At Dundalk Handicap
quotes.quote: Shoot To Kill has been slipping down the weights. He had the inside draw and Donagh was able to keep it simple once he got a lead. He's a horse with plenty of talent and hopefully that will have got his confidence back - Stephen Thorne, trainer.

quotes.race: MansionBet Proud Partners Of The AWC Handicap
quotes.quote: Shoot To Kill did that well and may well get further in time. He pulls up a bit when in front so may well have more to give - Darragh Keenan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He is a slightly frustrating customer as he is a very good worker at home but does not always transfer that ability to the racecourse. He put his best foot forward last month when winning at Chelmsford over 6f and in fairness to the horse he has been unlucky at times, but he has this propensity to throw away his good luck on occasions. His subsequent effort at Wolverhampton was not his fault as he was almost knocked over. We will be aiming him at 6f handicaps on good, fast summer ground and I am sure there is a nice race to be won. We may dip him in the deep end occasionally as he could go well in one of those races off a featherweight. 14-04-21

runners.name: Earls
runners.comment: Needs to improve on Irish Lincoln run but possible and handles ground
runners.spotlight: Ten wins to his name, last three have been on soft/heavy; didn't land a blow but wasn't disgraced on seasonal return in Irish Lincoln in March so not one to rule out (handles good ground too).

quotes.race: Listowel Arms Hotel Handicap
quotes.quote: Earls is as game as a pebble. When I got him out and rolling in the straight, he really put the head down and hit the line really good. He showed he stayed the mile today too. Hopefully he's not finished, he's only winning by short margins so the handicapper can't kill him - Garry Carroll, jockey.

quotes.race: Mehmas Handicap
quotes.quote: Earls has been in the paddock since he came home, I didn't know what to expect. When I saw he had an entry I thought he was one we could claim and then run again quickly. We'll give him a bit of a break now and get to know him a bit more - Garvan Donnelly, trainer

quotes.race: Tattersalls Ireland Handicap
quotes.quote: He normally likes to make the running but there was loads of pace so he couldn't. He pulled up a bit in front but it was a funny race and he was out on his own. There was a fair wind as well. He's in again on Thursday at Navan so we'll see how he is in the morning. I think he'll handle Dundalk as well - trainer Eddie Lynam.

runners.name: Dark Viper
runners.comment: Won here over 1m in March; needs a decent pace at this trip
runners.spotlight: Finally got off the mark when winning here over 1m in March (good); probably wasn't suited by steadily-run 7f at Cork last time so still respected but will want a true test.

quotes.race: Legacy Wine Bar Handicap
quotes.quote: If there was ever a horse who deserved a win it's Dark Viper. He's a stable favourite and a good lead horse. He had a blow at the Curragh so we knew he would step forward fitness-wise and I think the better ground and step up in trip suited. It wouldn't surprise me if he went in again - Shane Foley, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: After failing to get his head in front in his first 19 starts, he finally did it at Leopardstown the other day. I was beginning to wonder if he ever would but thank God he did. You could run him every day of the week if you needed to. Seven furlongs or a mile, either trip is no problem to him at all. 23-04-25

runners.name: Genesis
runners.comment: Encouraging Curragh comeback run over this trip; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Dundalk maiden winner last year has had limited opportunities on turf but encouraging comeback run at the Curragh last month when made plenty of use in finishing third over 7f (good); one to consider.

runners.name: Black Storm
runners.comment: Didn't count on recent seasonal return at the Curragh and fair bit to find with Genesis
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo won AW maiden last October; didn't count on recent seasonal return at the Curragh and has a fair bit to find with Genesis on that run.

runners.name: Acapulco Bay
runners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith
runners.comment: Last in Derby Trial but step up in trip could be what he needs
runners.spotlight: Curragh 2yo maiden winner chased home shorter-priced stablemate (and close French Derby fourth) Trinity College in testing conditions at Naas in March but never a threat when last of five behind Delacroix in Derby Trial here last month; good chance he'll improve for this step up in trip (dam stayed well).

quotes.race: Kara Quinn Memorial Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Acapulco Bay was very green in front. Ryan said he never picked up the bridle at all and felt he was in second gear - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well when second at Naas over a mile last month and should come forward for that run. He'll definitely get a mile and a quarter and could get further. 07-04-25

runners.name: Arouet
runners.comment: Roscommon winner should have good bit more to offer, providing he stays
runners.spotlight: Galiway colt reversed a Cork maiden debut defeat by Nautical Force in April by comfortably beating that rival when in receipt of weight in Roscommon median auction event over same trip (1m2f) following month on better ground; not certain to stay this trip on breeding but looks to have plenty more to offer.

runners.name: Rock Of Cashel
runners.owner: Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier
runners.comment: Highly-tried but exposed and Moore prefers Acapulco Bay
runners.spotlight: Talented enough colt but invariably plays second fiddle to better-fancied stablemates, including both starts this term at this venue, fourth of five in Derby Trial latest when acting as a pacemaker; Moore prefers Acapulco Bay.

runners.name: Titanium Emperor
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
runners.comment: Well held at this level over 1m; needs to improve considerably for step up in trip
runners.spotlight: Night Of Thunder colt made Dundalk debut win in March but safely held both starts since at Listed level over 1m; needs to improve considerably for this big step up in trip to play a role.

runners.name: Whats Your Game
runners.owner: Amo Racing Limited & Giselle De Aguiar
runners.comment: Navan Listed second going the right way, no stamina doubts so could feature
runners.spotlight: Off the mark upped to this trip in Cork handicap in April (soft) and better again when second to an improver in Navan Listed over 1m5f on good ground; going the right way, no stamina doubts so could feature.

runners.name: Zahrann
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: Cork maiden winner bred to relish this trip; very interesting despite big jump in class
runners.spotlight: Night Of Thunder colt didn't debut until April when touched off in Navan maiden and following month landed odds over 1m2f at Cork, still green but powering away inside final furlong; bred to relish 1m4f and very interesting contender despite big jump in class.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Zahrann was still slowly away and is still a big baby. He was on and off the bridle the whole way but, when I grabbed hold of him turning in, he really came alive. He quickened up smartly and lengthened the whole way to the line. That trip was very comfortable for him and an extra two furlongs will be within his compass as well - Ben Coen, jockey, speaking to RacingTV.

runners.name: Bay Colony
runners.comment: Limerick fillies' maiden winner at this trip but big step up in class now
runners.spotlight: Highly-tried at two and back to maiden company both starts this term, latest when scoring over this trip in testing ground in Limerick fillies contest; big step up in class here.

runners.name: Dawn Spirit
runners.breeder: Al Shira'Aa Farms S A R L
runners.comment: Cork maiden win franked since and likely more to come upped to 1m4f
runners.spotlight: Nicely improved under a positive ride to win 1m2f Cork fillies' maiden last month (second won next time); good chance she'll stay 1m4f and has to be respected.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF 3yo Spring Series Median Auction Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: Dawn Spirit is a nice filly, has always shown more at home than in her two runs but the last day she didn't like being crowded. She is a big filly and hopefully it is onwards and upwards now. I'm sure she'll have no problem going 1m4f - Dylan Browne McMonagle, jockey speaking to RacingTV.

runners.name: Nuit
runners.comment: Just denied in recent C&D handicap; this a different level altogether
runners.spotlight: Maiden's best run came on latest when just denied in C&D handicap last month, finishing strongly after not clear passage; much deeper waters here but likely more to offer.

5:55.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Glencairn Stakes (Listed Race)

runners.name: Norwalk Havoc
runners.comment: Won a 1m Listed race at this track in November, best suited by soft ground, second-string
runners.spotlight: Last year's two early-season wins came on soft/heavy; confirmed a liking for testing conditions when landing a 1m Listed race at this track in November; form also included a neck second on yielding ground in the Colm Quinn BMW Mile Handicap at Galway; did best of those in centre group when ninth of 31 in the Cambridgeshire (1m soft); stable's second string.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Race
quotes.quote: Norwalk Havoc stays well and I had to commit him sooner than ideal. I think he'll be better in a better race - Shane Foley, jockey, speaking to RTV.

quotes.race: 1888 Restaurant (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Norwalk Havoc didn't behave very well at the Curragh last year and we gelded him after that which seems to have done the job. We always thought he had ability but he just wasn't giving it to us. I thought when he got upsides at the furlong pole he was going to just think about it but he actually ran out a ready winner and stayed on great. Shane said he couldn't go any quicker early on and that he went through the ground very easily. We'll look for a winners-of-one - Jessica Harrington, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He did great at three. He won a Listed race at Leopardstown over a mile on his final outing of last season. I really think he'll stay a mile and a quarter this season and that will open a lot more doors for us, which is great. He needs ease in the ground. He's grown up a lot. 23-04-25

runners.name: Bravais

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late K Abdullah

runners.comment: Improved from Irish debut to win at Tipperary, should confirm form with Cristal Clere
runners.spotlight: Two wins over 7f in 2023 for Andre Fabre and ran well in defeat in Group races up to 1m4f; struggled over an extended 1m2f at Naas in March on stable debut after a long absence; different proposition six weeks ago when winning a Tipperary conditions event over an extended 7f; should confirm form with third-placed Cristal Clere.

runners.name: Cristal Clere

prev_owners.owner: G & M Roberts, Green, Savidge & Whittal-Williams

runners.comment: Third behind Bravais over an inadequate trip at Tipperary, stays further than this
runners.spotlight: Gained all three wins in 2023, including handicaps over 1m and 1m2f at this venue on heavy ground; solid form in defeat last season, notably when second in 1m4f Listed races at Roscommon and Chester; ran well to finish third behind Bravais over an inadequate trip at Tipperary six weeks ago.

quotes.race: SHEIN Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Cristal Clere had great runs last summer and is a really consistent horse. He took off on the soft ground the other day and again today - John Nallen, trainer.

runners.name: Layfayette
runners.comment: Solid performer overall, 0-10 record at this track is a negative, others preferred
runners.spotlight: Winner of nine of his 39 starts; 6-27 in stakes races, best form at the Curragh, four wins at 1m-1m2f, including two Group 3s and a Group 2; 4-13 Curragh record contrasts with his 0-10 record at this track; ran well when second over 1m2f here on his penultimate start last season; last of six over 1m here on seasonal debut.

quotes.race: Fitzdares Royal Whip Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted for Layfayette and I'm delighted to see Helvic Dream come back to a bit of form as well. I was disappointed the last day at Naas but he had a bit of time off after getting some treatment on his back and he got stuffy and blew up. Colin looked to be travelling well and I thought he was going to pick them up once he went for him. He loves this place and the long straight. He probably will go for the Leopardstown Paddy Power Stakes over 1m4f if there is an ease in the ground - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Tally Ho Stud Irish EBF Martin Molony Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Layfayette is an enthusiastic horse and he likes to win. It got a bit tight and there was a loose one but he won very easy - Seamie Heffernan, rider

quotes.race: Coolmore Sottsass Irish EBF Mooresbridge Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Layfayette nearly got there too soon. He's beaten the same horses again but has beaten them better and I thought he travelled better today - Noel Meade, trainer

quotes.race: Hollywoodbets Alleged Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: The two of them did a little piece of work the other morning, Colin [Keane] rode the other fella and Oisin [Orr] rode Layfayette. He worked so well I said I couldn't not run him. This fella goes on any ground, maybe not heavy but he goes on most ground. He's just getting better and Oisin thinks he'll be better over a bit further - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Lenebane Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Layfayette didn't let down on quick ground last year but he handled it. They went hard up front and I was able to ride a nice waiting race on him. There might be something for him on Champions Weekend - Chris Hayes, rider.

quotes.race: Paddy Power Irish Lincolnshire (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: I put cheekpieces on him and Chris (Hayes) said they made some difference to him. He's quite a nice horse and hopefully he'll be able to build on that. The first day he ran here last year the ground was very quick and it took him a long time to get over it as he was sore after the run. He's not a hurdler, he's not that shape, and he has quite a flicky action. He'll get further - Noel Meade, trainer

quotes.race: Good Luck To Our 20 Lockdown Heroes Handicap
quotes.quote: I didn't think he was going to win at any stage. I don't know whether that was the ground or whether he's gone lazy, but I suppose when he races like that it helps him to see out the trip. He'd been coming home every time and that's the first time we pushed him out to that trip. I'd say he will run on Irish Champions Weekend if he gets in - Noel Meade, trainer

quotes.race: Foran Equine Irish EBF Auction Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: He got into a lot of trouble the last day at the Curragh and we fancied him today. He jumped very quick at the Curragh and Colin made a decision to take him back, but when he took him back he could never get out after that. He did come home really well - Noel Meade, trainer

stable_tour.quote: The race can obviously be a bit of a lottery but we're hoping to take our chance. He ran well at the Curragh on Guineas weekend when fourth after probably being a bit unfortunate in running. The handicapper put him up 2lb for that and hopefully he'll have a chance of getting in at the weights. 08-06-21

runners.name: Azada
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan
runners.comment: 1m Listed winner, should be better for her reappearance in a Group 2 race at the Curragh
runners.spotlight: Heavy ground juvenile maiden winner over 1m at this venue; ran creditably on return last year in the Irish 1000 Guineas; and ended a four-race campaign with a 1m Listed win at Naas; should be better for her reappearance in a Group 2 race at the Curragh and will be more at home in this grade.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Garnet Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies & Mares)
quotes.quote: Azada ran a very good race in the Irish 1,000 Guineas and won well as a two-year-old. The nine and a half furlongs might have been a little too far for her last time at Gowran. She'd been working well and I thought she might be hard to beat today. She's a very big filly and there's a possibility she may be kept in training next year - Dermot Weld, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: Azada travelled away and I thought if she showed here what she was showing at home that she would take a lot of beating. When I gave her a little kick she came alive. She is going to be a very nice filly next year - Leigh Roche, rider

runners.name: Green Impact
runners.comment: Twice beat Derby hopeful Delacroix at two, sixth in 2,000 Guineas, looks the part here
runners.spotlight: Won 1m maiden here on good-to-yielding last July on second run and followed up in 1m Group 2 Juvenile Stakes here on good) in September, both times beating Delacroix, now a prime Derby candidate, appear to become unbalanced in the Dip when sixth to Ruling Court in the 2,000 Guineas; looks the part in this company.

quotes.race: KPMG Champions Juvenile Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: Green Impact was always a lovely horse, very laid-back and very easy to train. He's a very big horse and I think we probably haven't seen the best of him yet. We can dream all winter. I think we'll see a really nice horse next year - Jessica Harrington, trainer.

quotes.race: Frank Conroy Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Green Impact is a very big and laid back horse. I don't think we will be going anywhere in a hurry. Whatever he does now, he's only going to get better - Jessica Harrington, trainer

stable_tour.quote: He's done very well from two to three. He worked at the Curragh after racing last Saturday week and he was excellent, so we're all systems go now for the 2,000 Guineas at Newmarket. I definitely think he's a Guineas type. He can quicken up off a good, fast pace and he's a big, strong horse, so he can take all the hustle and bustle of a race like the Guineas. I think he has enough pace too - he showed enough pace to get to the front at Leopardstown and had enough to stay there. He's uncomplicated, well balanced and he'll take the preliminaries well - he'll be very relaxed, walking around the parade ring with his head on the ground. Nothing fazes him. We're looking forward to the Guineas with him but really looking forward to stepping him up in trip as the season progresses as well. 23-04-25

runners.name: Currawood
runners.comment: Second to the useful Officer over 1m at the Curragh in his first stakes race; needs more
runners.spotlight: Twice runner-up in 2yo maidens and has trained on well; won his first two starts this season, a Dundalk maiden and much improved in new headgear combination and step up to 1m to run away with Cork median auction race on soft; second to the useful Officer over 1m at the Curragh in his first stakes race; should stay the extra furlong

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Median Auction Maiden (Median Auction Race)
quotes.quote: Currawood is a nice horse. I thought the race conditions suited him and the track suited him, he has a good action. He was a little bit immature as a two-year-old, he was up behind and a bit down in front so I just took my time with him. He's levelled out over the winter and he's become the horse that his frame said he would, he's got a bit of length and scope. He'll go to Cork in a winners' race around a mile in April - Paddy Twomey, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Eastwatch
runners.comment: Wide-margin winner of Gowran maiden in March, should not be out of place in this grade
runners.spotlight: Made a pleasing introduction when third over 1m at Tipperary last October, form franked by runner-up Serious Contender with two wins at this venue; wide-margin winner of Gowran maiden over a bit further than this in March; should not be out of place in this grade

6:25.race_name: BoyleSports 'Home Of The Early Payout' Handicap

runners.name: Pierre Royal
runners.comment: Gowran maiden winner very interesting stepping into handicap company here
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to 1m winner Red Viburnum followed up encouraging Gowran debut run last month by taking similar contest three weeks later, making all in a weaker affair; very interesting into handicap company here off a mark he could well better and extra furlong no problem.

quotes.race: INPBA Sponsored Gate June 2nd Maiden
quotes.quote: He's a grand colt, Pierre Royal knew his job and Chris (Hayes) gave him lovely ride. He's still immature so we won't rush him, we'll see how he progresses during the year - Dermot Weld, trainer, speaking to Racing TV

runners.name: Cap Saint Martin
runners.comment: Comeback run underwhelming but trip could suit and unwise to rule out on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Curragh maiden winner last autumn had an underwhelming seasonal return in 1m2f Roscommon median auction contest last month (winner Arouet runs in Listed race on this card) but was eased once chance had gone; slight drop in trip could suit and unwise to rule out on handicap debut.

runners.name: Wizard Of Odds
runners.owner: Dont Tell Bernie Syndicate/E Hogan/Shamrock Thoroughbreds

prev_owners.owner: Dont Tell Bernie Syndicate/E Hogan/Shamrock Thoroughbreds

runners.comment: Best form at 7f, stamina concerns over this trip
runners.spotlight: Maiden winner last year over 7f on good ground ran well in defeat after; ran a cracker on seasonal return over 7f at Naas on testing ground but didn't much luck in running when well held at same venue in April; cheekpieces now tried and upped in trip with others preferred.

runners.name: J Ms Joy
runners.comment: Excuses latest; may yet do better but may want easier ground
runners.spotlight: Joined Gavin Cromwell this year, making a lot of the running to win 1m2f soft-ground maiden at the Curragh but well held both starts since, out of depth in Group 3 and never counted after stumbling early in Sligo fillies' handicap;   may yet do better but may want easier ground.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF 3yo Spring Series Median Auction Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: J M's Joy surprised me as it wasn't the plan to make the running, she kind of ended up there. I thought she went a good gallop and I wasn't sure whether she'd see it out over the trip but she was gutsy. She was fit and had a couple of runs, while she handled the ground well. It's a nice pot to win - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

runners.name: Sound Of Lightning
runners.comment: Naas maiden winner with more to offer at this trip and likely big player on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Nicely improved on third maiden attempt, relishing return to a sound surface in Naas fillies' contest last month, settling better and quickening up well to assert late; longer trip to suit, has her ground and likely set for bold bid on handicap debut.

quotes.race: Twydil/Clovelly Irish EBF Fillies Maiden
quotes.quote: Sound Of Lightning had a very good run the first day but ran with the choke out for the first few furlongs at Navan. We said we'd come back in trip and get her to relax early, which she did. She finished off nicely so it's nice to get her back on track. I think the better ground suited but getting her to switch off was more important than the ground. She has a great pedigree and you'd love to get a bit of black-type. We'll try and find a nice Listed race and she'll stay a mile and a quarter if she does things right - Donnacha O'Brien, trainer .

runners.name: Monotone
runners.comment: Longer trip a concern and wants easier ground
runners.spotlight: Cork 2yo maiden winner didn't kick on last season; back on track with a staying-on third at Gowran (7f, yielding) in April but couldn't back that up at the Curragh next time and now steps up in trip.

runners.name: Daler
runners.breeder: Irish National Stud Mare Syndicate Iv
runners.comment: Entitled to come on for recent comeback run but still others preferred on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Promise in maidens at two but no improvement on Gowran comeback run last month (1m, good); entitled to come on for that but still others preferred on handicap debut.

runners.name: Iowntheball
runners.comment: Decent AW form over winter; gelded since and back from a break off a fair mark
runners.spotlight: Won a Down Royal maiden over 7f last summer and two decent efforts in defeat at Dundalk over the winter; gelded since and back from a break off a fair mark with Billy Lee booked.

quotes.race: SBD Events Pro Median Auction Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Iowntheball is a good sort and still very raw. He had a good look when he got to the front and he will improve plenty for this, that he was able to win today is testament to his ability - Gary Halpin, rider

runners.name: Jamarr
runners.comment: Beaten favourite at Cork but step up in trip here could suit and not one to rule out
runners.spotlight: Dual 1m AW nursery winner over the winter and didn't run badly in defeat on turf return in Cork apprentice handicap last month, running on again late over 1m; step up in trip here could suit and not one to rule out.

runners.name: Lady In Paris
runners.comment: 4.25l to find with Sound Of Lightning on recent Naas form entering handicap company
runners.spotlight: Showed a fair standard of form at two and took a step forward on last month's seasonal return when 4.25l off Sound Of Lightning in Naas fillies' maiden; good bit more needed to reverse that form here on handicap debut though.

stable_tour.quote: A Blue Point filly who ran in some hot maidens as a two-year-old and we think there's plenty more to come from her at three. She's nice. 23-04-25

runners.name: Its All Peachy
runners.comment: Maiden form puts her in the mix despite underwhelming previous handicap effort
runners.spotlight: Promise in a couple of 1m Gowran maidens this term, most recently pace throughout when beaten 1l by an odds-on shot last month on good ground, hanging left; in between well held in Naas handicap after slow start; don't rule out.

runners.name: Echinacea
runners.comment: Potential improver entering handicaps and longer trip could suit
runners.spotlight: Promise in maidens, most recently not clear run here over 1m last month; suspicion remains she is capable of better so not one to dismiss lightly entering handicap company (1lb wrong) and longer trip could suit.

6:55.race_name: Bulmers Live At Leopardstown Handicap (Div I)

runners.name: Bill Silvers
runners.comment: Both runs this term disappointing; reduced mark and drops in grade but still opposable
runners.spotlight: Won 7f maiden on soft ground for Harry Eustace at three; started 2024 season brightly before losing form and two early-season runs this term well below best (blinkered last time); reduced mark and drops in grade but still need to see more spark before backable.

runners.name: The Real Screamer
runners.comment: Last week's claiming winner upped 9lb so stiff enough task, especially from wide draw
runners.spotlight: Solid enough handicap form this year before dropped to claiming company to win easily over this trip at Tipperary last week on softer ground; up 9lb for that however so stiff enough task and outside draw no help.

runners.name: Flying Bay
runners.comment: Potential improver entering handicaps and yard's few recent runners have gone well
runners.spotlight: It wasn't a strong maiden he won at Galway (1m, soft) last August but potential improver entering handicaps and yard's few recent runners have gone well.

runners.name: Alpha Capture
runners.comment: Absent since Galway festival second over 1m4f; contender if fully tuned up on return
runners.spotlight: Listed winner at 2 for William Haggas when he had a rating of 103; successful on his second run for Willie Mullins in 1m Killarney handicap last summer and ended season with strong-finishing Galway second (1m4f) in August off today's mark; contender if fully tuned up on seasonal return and Keane remains loyal.

runners.name: Tachos
runners.comment: On a fair mark on seasonal return though drawn not great
runners.spotlight: Gowran winner last summer at this trip (good) and some good placed runs afterwards, including final start when close third at Navan when visored (now replaced by tongue-tie); on a fair mark though drawn not great.

quotes.race: Ladies Day July 27th Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Tachos is a gorgeous filly, has a lovely attitude and is very laid-back. That's probably her right trip, she's a mile-and-a-quarter filly. During the summer hopefully there is another one for her - Dermot Weld, trainer.

runners.name: Zephron
runners.owner: R J Proudfoot & Mrs Ann-Marie Cullen
runners.comment: Likely best watched on seasonal return with question marks over trip/ground
runners.spotlight: Three of five wins have been at the Curragh on soft/heavy over shorter; likely best watched on seasonal return with question marks over trip/ground.

quotes.race: Mongey Communications Handicap
quotes.quote: Zephron has been great all year and has probably been unlucky not to win three. He loves those conditions and we'll see what he can do next year - Denis Cullen, trainer

quotes.race: Sentinel Ireland Handicap
quotes.quote: The cheekpieces worked out well over six furlongs and Annalise gave Zephron a great ride. She stuck to the rail and it's great for her to get her first winner at the Curragh - Denis Cullen, trainer.

runners.name: Tribal Moon
runners.comment: AW wins have been at 1m but every chance he'll stay on turf return
runners.spotlight: Dual 1m AW winner last winter and solid enough efforts when last seen in March, second occasion when barely getting home over 1m2f; this trip should be in his range.

runners.name: Kaptain Bay
runners.comment: Back from hurdling, could have more to offer in first flat handicap with ground to suit
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced on flat last year, Curragh maiden fourth (1m2f) his best effort; fair level of form hurdling, winning Bellewstown maiden and most recently decent second at Kilbeggan; likes decent ground, could have more to offer back on the level in first handicap.

runners.name: Stormie Outlook
runners.owner: Sean H Reynolds & E J Ogrady
runners.comment: Winning form at 1m; recent maiden hurdle form a bit underwhelming
runners.spotlight: Experienced handicapper with two wins on good ground last summer at 1m; recent maiden hurdle form a bit underwhelming and slight concern over this trip back on the level.

runners.name: Zipster
runners.comment: Ridden to stay 1m2f at Roscommon which he did; one to consider now with stamina proven
runners.spotlight: Two wins for the Crisfords were over 1m but seemed to stay okay when third at Roscommon recently over 1m2f (good), just ahead of The Real Screamer who is now much worse off at the weights; one to consider.

runners.name: Moyassr
runners.comment: Tame finish in cheekpieces (now left off) latest; not sure this extra 1f is what he wants
runners.spotlight: AW winner over 1m last winter has run solid races this term at same trip though tame finish in cheekpieces (now left off) latest at the Curragh; not sure this extra furlong is what he wants.

runners.name: Loingseoir
runners.owner: W Keeling & M C Grassick & Mrs M J Grassick

prev_owners.owner: Mrs M J Grassick/T Oliver Hudson/M C Grassick/W Keeling
Patrick Pearse & W Keeling & M C Grassick & Mrs M J Grassick
Patrick Pearse & M C Grassick & Mrs M J Grassick

runners.comment: Trip-versatile 9yo; can't rule out but others preferred
runners.spotlight: Six-time winner over trips from 7f to 1m4f; touched off at Limerick over 1m, best effort this term, left with fair bit to do at Fairyhouse latest; can't rule out but others preferred.

quotes.race: O'Reilly Consulting Group Supporting The IRFU Charitable Trust Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Loingseoir was 5lb higher than when winning this race last year. He loves that ground and coming home from off a strong pace. The handicapper hasn't been kind to him all year. He ran well at Galway but then got 3lb and it took a long time for him to get down to where he's competitive. He's a grand horse to have in the yard. I'm sure there'll be another race for him back here, he likes the Curragh - Michael Grassick, trainer

quotes.race: Fermoy Handicap
quotes.quote: He jumped a little slowly but I let him get into his rhythm. He quickened up well in the straight and won well at the line. He was good and tough. He stuck his head out and he galloped right to the line. He loved the ground - Mikey Sheehy, rider of Loingseoir

runners.name: Space Warrior
runners.owner: Mrs Helen Mullins & M J Lomax
runners.comment: Winning hurdler return to flat with ground to suit; wide draw a negative though
runners.spotlight: Pick of five maiden runs on the flat last year when fourth at Killarney (1m, heavy) before winning hurdles debut at Fairyhouse in November (good); hasn't progressed however, often keen and not too fluent; back on the flat now with ground to suit but wide draw a negative.

quotes.race: Starting Point 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Space Warrior had schooled well, although I didn't think he will win first time. He jumped well and Danny was very good on him. I don't know what the plan is - Tom Mullins, trainer

runners.name: Speckled Meadow
runners.comment: Runs well fresh but this ground is quicker than she wants
runners.spotlight: All three wins have come on testing ground, including here last year; runs well fresh but this ground is quicker than she wants.

quotes.race: Moyne Handicap
quotes.quote: I had ridden Speckled Meadow the last two times. She was disappointing last time but the time before ran a cracker when she bumped into a good one at Navan. She got worked up in the stalls at Gowran last time, missed the kick and it was game over. In fairness to the lads, they brought her away and gave her stalls work and it has worked - Adam Caffrey, rider

runners.name: Captain Hanley
runners.comment: Unexposed 5yo entering handicap; hard to make a case for on evidence to-date
runners.spotlight: Unexposed 5yo entering handicap after just three maiden runs over various trips, no show when soundly beaten at Tipperary last week; hard to make a case for on evidence to-date and opening mark looks high.

runners.name: Pillar Of Hope
runners.comment: Dundalk second last time a step in the right direction; 7lb higher turf  mark though
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner in Britain (three on turf); 0-14 in Ireland but ran best race for this yard when second of 12 at Dundalk (1m2f) off 58 in March; 7lb higher back on turf but claimer offsets that.

runners.name: Rampage
runners.owner: Mrs P Mccourt/Whytes Stamullen Syndicate/S Sweeney
runners.comment: Suffered from high draws last two visits here, kinder draw today but still more needed
runners.spotlight: Won twice on turf over 1m1f in 2023 (including over C&D) and landed AW handicap last year; pick of five runs this year when only beaten 2.5l from a wide draw here in March, even worse draw here last month when well held; kinder draw today.

quotes.race: James P. Cunningham Electrical Handicap
quotes.quote: The stiffer track suited Rampage today. We were a bit worried about the ground but he showed us he is well able for it. We took a while to get to know him but he seems to be in a good vein of form. He was due his head in front again. It opened up well for me, he got the splits at the right time and when he gets there he just does enough - James Ryan, jockey.

runners.name: Unterberg
runners.comment: Went close over 1m at Cork last month; extra 1f and good ground in his favour
runners.spotlight: Dual AW winner but 0-13 on turf, although has twice gone close at Cork including last month over inadequate 1m; extra 1f and good ground in his favour so don't rule out.

quotes.race: HRI Best Turned-Out Flat League Finale Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Unterberg saw it out really well, there was a good gallop on and it suited - Oisin McSweeney, jockey, talking to Racing TV

runners.name: Whist
runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo showed glimpses of ability in maidens last year; watching brief advised
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 4yo filly showed glimpses of ability in four maidens in second half of last season; watching brief advised on seasonal return.

runners.name: Wertpol
runners.comment: Attracted support when second in a maiden at Ballinrobe, open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Attracted support when second at Ballinrobe on the most recent of three maiden starts, has a slight edge over fourth-placed Amplitude; open to improvement.

runners.name: All Right By Me
runners.comment: Promising handicap debut over 1m at Dundalk, failed to stay 1m2f at Navan, gelded since
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far in strong 6f Curragh maiden on debut when 4l sixth behind Henri Matisse; that promise remains unfulfilled but he ran respectably over 1m at Dundalk in his first handicap; failed to stay 1m2f at Navan, gelded since.

runners.name: Amplitude
runners.comment: Did not seem to handle the track at Ballinrobe, not far off runner-up Wertpol in that race
runners.spotlight: Did not seem to handle the track at Ballinrobe on latest; not far off runner-up Wertpol in that race; both now make handicap debut.

runners.name: Sheamus Seimhiu
runners.comment: Three-figure odds in all three maiden starts, some merit in runs at Cork and the Curragh
runners.spotlight: Three-figure odds in all three maiden starts; some merit in runs at Cork and the Curragh; others have more obvious credentials.

runners.name: Tam Lin
runners.comment: 7f AW winner, successful over 1m on turf, not beaten far over 7f at Fairyhouse on latest
runners.spotlight: 7f AW winner last winter; successful over this trip a Bellewstown in April; not beaten far over 7f at Fairyhouse on latest and is better drawn here than Great Mover who finished third in that race; good each-way prospects.

runners.name: You Are Mine
runners.comment: Tailed off in a 1m2f handicap here in March, faced a stiff task in a Cork maiden last time
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in a 1m2f handicap here in March; faced a stiff task in a Cork maiden last time; plenty to prove at this stage.

runners.name: Refreshment
runners.comment: Not one of his better efforts at Killarney, considerable improvement needed, blinkered now
runners.spotlight: Not one of his better efforts at Killarney; form has included sixth behind today's rival Tam Lin at Bellewstown; considerable improvement needed; blinkered now.

runners.name: Amber Blossom
runners.comment: Failed to reproduce useful Dundalk form in a Roscommon race contested by several of these
runners.spotlight: Good form at Dundalk between last November and March, notching a win and two seconds from four visits; failed to reproduce AW form in a Roscommon race contested by several of these rivals; first-time cheekpieces.

runners.name: Great Mover
runners.comment: Met trouble in running before staying on late at Fairyhouse last week, could be in the mix
runners.spotlight: Fair form in two 1m nurseries, on good and yielding ground; improved from seasonal debut at Roscommon (three of these rivals in front of her then) when staying on late at Fairyhouse last week; could be in the mix, though cause may be harmed by a high draw.

runners.name: Moonhall Lass
runners.comment: Worth a shot at this trip following Roscommon third with several of these rivals behind
runners.spotlight: 14-race maiden, runner-up in 5f nurseries at Down Royal and Dundalk last season; worth a shot at this trip following her Roscommon third with several of these rivals behind.

runners.name: Faoladh
runners.comment: Unplaced in a maiden last time, previous handicap fourth at Limerick was encouraging
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in a maiden at Ballinrobe last time; previous handicap fourth over this trip at Limerick was encouraging.

runners.name: Rising Sky
runners.comment: Hinted at potential for success at Roscommon, split Moonhall Lass and Widely Acclaimed
runners.spotlight: Took a small step forward on third maiden start at Dundalk (7f); hinted at potential for minor handicap success when fourth at Roscommonn, splitting Moonhall Lass and Widely Acclaimed, with Great Mover in sixth.

runners.name: Vegas Muse
runners.comment: Well supported on both handicap starts, not far off four of these rivals at Roscommon
runners.spotlight: Only 5-1 for handicap debut at Gowran (1m) where she was seventh of 16; again quite well fancied when sixth at Roscommon; eased when chance had gone, renews rivalry with Moonhall Lass, Rising Sky, Widely Acclaimed and Great Mover

runners.name: Your Call
runners.owner: Mrs Caroline Hendron & Mrs M Cahill & Ciaran Kennelly
runners.comment: 0-9 on turf, won a 7f Dundalk handicap off 59 last December, dismal 1m2f run on latest
runners.spotlight: 0-9 on turf, won a 7f handicap on the AW off 59 last December; struggled from an early stage in a 1m2f handicap at Navan in March and was tailed off.

runners.name: The Dark Baron
runners.comment: Looked in need of further at Roscommon, needs to reverse form with five of these rivals
runners.spotlight: Looked in need of further when making his handicap debut at Roscommon; needs to reverse form with five of these rivals.

runners.name: Tilani
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Mid-field at Galway on his only nursery start, new yard now, may improve with cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in three maidens; mid-field over 7f at Galway on his only nursery start; has joined Dermot Weld and may improve with cheekpieces.

runners.name: Blackjack Hills
runners.comment: Weak form over 1m2f at Navan, looked more effective over 1m at Gowran on his second start
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in two Navan maiden runs at 1m2f; looked more effective over 1m at Gowran on his second outing.

runners.name: Widely Acclaimed
runners.comment: Seems to be improving, not far behind Moonhall Lass and Rising Sky when fifth at Roscommon
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far in fifth over a little further at Roscommon; seems to be improving and was close on the heels of Moonhall Lass (third) and Rising Sky (fourth) in the Roscommon race.

runners.name: Weegeebear
runners.owner: Mark Devlin & Nigel Ohare & Philip Smith
runners.comment: Won 1m claimer at Gowran in April, uneven form in four starts since, often slow to break
runners.spotlight: 1-13 on turf; that win came in a 1m claimer at Gowran (soft) in April; uneven form in four starts since, though placed twice; slow-starting tendency is a concern.

quotes.race: Golf At Gowran Park Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Weegeebear actually jumped slow and I went to plan B straightaway, down the rail. I was able to scoot up their inside turning the bend and got a really nice position. He travelled into the straight really well and quickened up. He's hit the line strong. He had been slowly away at Bellewstown last time. When you jump slow around Bellewstown it's hard to get into it, we struggled all the way really. I'm glad he's gone and done it today - Adam Caffrey, jockey.

runners.name: Ballymagreehan
runners.comment: Modest form in three maiden runs over 6f, may do better over this trip on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Uncompetitive in two 6f maidens for Michael Halford; similar on stable debut at Dundalk, may do better over this trip on handicap debut.

runners.name: Clever And Classy
runners.owner: Mrs Marguerite Bolger & Mrs J S Bolger
runners.comment: First reserve, Roscommon run was disappointing, possibly came too soon after Gowran second
runners.spotlight: Roscommon run was disappointing; possibly came too soon after Gowran second; first reserve

runners.name: Micasso
runners.comment: Second reserve, weak maiden form, some promise from two handicap runs, more needed
runners.spotlight: Weak maiden form; some promise from two handicap runs; more needed; second reserve

runners.name: James The Second
runners.comment: Third reserve, lost his chance at the start on latest, had been showing mild promise
runners.spotlight: Lost his chance at the start on latest; had been showing mild promise; third reserve

7:30.race_name: Bulmers Live At Leopardstown Handicap (Div II)

runners.name: Arch Enemy
runners.comment: Won a strong 1m4f handicap at this venue last autumn, best form over further than this
runners.spotlight: Six wins on the Flat, notably a strong 1m4f handicap at this venue last autumn; hurdles winner during the winter; best form over further than this, though down the field over 1m6f at the Curragh 11 days ago.

quotes.race: Bay Leaf Handicap
quotes.quote: Arch Enemy was always running well but we were waiting for this day. She didn't get a hard race at Leopardstown so we came here today. She got away alright today and she got the breaks today - Patrick Magee, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Racing Yearbook 2022 Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Arch Enemy has had a few goes and has had some good runs, it has just taken time to get it together. I think she'll stay further - Mick Mulvany, trainer.

runners.name: Solomon
runners.comment: Two wins for William Haggas, no sign of his best form in four outings in Ireland
runners.spotlight: AW winner is 1-7 on turf; that win came off 85 at Haydock (1m2f, good) for William Haggas last August; no sign of his best form in four outings in Ireland.

runners.name: Artful Approach
runners.comment: Fine second over 1m here on seasonal debut, not as effective on testing ground at Limerick
runners.spotlight: Won over 7f at Galway last summer for Jack Davison off 73; good run at same venue six days later; shaped well on yard debut in March when staying on late to finish second over 1m here; not as effective on testing ground at Limerick.

runners.name: Bear Profit
runners.comment: C&D winner last season, runner-up at the Curragh on the first of two 1m4f runs this term
runners.spotlight: C&D winner last summer and ended his campaign with a good run over 1m2f here; runner-up at the Curragh on the first of two 1m4f runs this term; failed to make much impact at this venue last time.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Lengthen The Odds Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Bear Profit just arrived there. Things didn't go right at Listowel when he raced too keen. He's not a bad horse and got a lovely ride - Ger O'Leary, trainer.

runners.name: Instant Appeal
runners.comment: Possibly failed to stay 1m2f here on seasonal debut, better when third over 1m at Naas
runners.spotlight: Third in Curragh maiden won by City Of Troy in July 2023; easy winner of a 7f Gowran maiden on only subsequent start at two; missed all last season; appeared not to stay 1m2f on his comeback at Leopardstown; better when third over 1m at Naas, 1 3/4l behind Killeaney Bear.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: I got a handy lead and Instant Appeal had a bit of experience on his side, I liked the way he picked up and he hit the line well - Scott McCullagh, jockey, talking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He was just too keen and fresh at Leopardstown and got tired. He could run at Limerick on Friday and we think he'll take a nice step forward from his first run. 23-04-25

runners.name: Molto Amichi
runners.comment: Maiden, went very close at Ballinrobe on seasonal debut, had an excuse at the Curragh
runners.spotlight: Promise in maidens at the end of last season and beaten only a nose at Ballinrobe on return; had an excuse at the Curragh suffered a graze, possibly incurred when giving problems in the stalls.

runners.name: Pier Pressure
runners.comment: Nine defeats since a 1m Gowran win last July but seldom beaten far, good 7lb claimer
runners.spotlight: Two wins at Dundalk. won a 1m Gowran handicap last summer; Nnne defeats since then but seldom beaten far; each-way chance with good 7lb claimer booked.

quotes.race: Gateway Hotel Dundalk Race & Stay Maiden
quotes.quote: Pier Pressure travelled into it nicely, He was still green and had a good look when he got there but he won snug enough - Jack Kearney, rider

runners.name: Killeaney Bear
runners.comment: Backed up a second placing over hurdles with another on the Flat at Naas, should go close
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner over 1m1f on a sound surface; third of five behind subsequent Grade 1-winning hurdler Hello Neighbour on last Flat 2024 start at Roscommon; runner-up in a maiden hurdle at Cork last month on first run after a break; same placing on the Flat at Naas eight days later; has an edge over Instant Appeal; strong chance.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Lengthen The Odds Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: Killeaney Bear didn't handle the track or the ground at Galway, but he pulled out of the race well and we chanced it. He's a big, raw horse and I would say there is more to come, especially next year - Andy Slattery, trainer.

runners.name: Ard Na Mara
runners.owner: Mrs J S Bolger & James Peter Dowling
runners.comment: Tipperary run was too bad to be true, has prospects on her previous second over 1m2f here
runners.spotlight: Won 1m1f Punchestown maiden last autumn; made a good start to the season when second over 1m2f at this venue; Tipperary run was too bad to be true; has had six weeks to get over it.

runners.name: Chavajod
runners.owner: D P Coakley & J F Costello & A Connick & P Coakley
runners.comment: Longer trip seemed to find him out at Roscommon, previously a narrow winner over 1m
runners.spotlight: Longer trip seemed to find him out at Roscommon last time; previously a narrow winner over 1m in testing conditions at Limerick.

quotes.race: Munster Suite @ Limerick Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Chavajod is the only horse we have so we have only one shot at it and I ride him out on his own everyday. Anytime he's run on soft ground before he's been tailed off but he handled it here. We might go back to Killarney with him in the summer - Denis Coakley, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Dream Escape
runners.comment: Down the field over hurdles at Ballinrobe recently, overall Flat form is unconvincing
runners.spotlight: Down the field over hurdles at Ballinrobe recently; overall Flat form is unconvincing, highlight when winning a five-runner maiden at Killarney in 2023.

runners.name: Letiza
runners.comment: In good form on her final three starts last year, could be in the mix on that evidence
runners.spotlight: Useful form in 2023, lost her way for a while last year before a revival for Henry de Bromhead; could be in the mix on the evidence of her final three starts before a break.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Fillies & Mares Maiden
quotes.quote: Letiza has been running well and I just think she pulled up a bit when she got there. She's not a bad filly but a pair of cheekpieces might help - John Feane, trainer.

runners.name: Nedita
runners.comment: Has done almost all her racing at Dundalk, has failed to prosper in two turf attempts
runners.spotlight: Has done almost all her racing at Dundalk, where she was in good form during the winter; has failed to prosper in two turf attempts, including at Coerk last month.

runners.name: Thatwilldoso
runners.comment: Started the season with an emphatic Gowran win, hike in the ratings has stalled progress
runners.spotlight: Started the season with an emphatic Gowran win; hike in the ratings has stalled progress; kept on late into fifth over C&D last month.

runners.name: Mapa
runners.comment: Placed only once in eight maiden starts, improvement needed from recent handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Placed only once in eight maiden starts; improvement needed from recent handicap debut at the Curragh.

runners.name: Dancing Steve
runners.comment: Tipperary winner over this trip last year, 1m6f stretched his stamina at Gowran on return
runners.spotlight: Tipperary winner over this trip last year; solid placed form at Dundalk last October/November; 1m6f stretched his stamina at Gowran on return.

runners.name: Pink Socks
runners.comment: Only one win from 26 starts but runner-up six times including at Gowran on final 2024 run
runners.spotlight: Only one win from 26 starts but runner-up six times including at Gowran on final 2024 run; rider's claim a big asset; good chance if fitness holds up; positives can be taken from last year's Gowran win on seasonal debut.

quotes.race: KCLR 96FM Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Pink Socks had a good campaign last year without winning. This mare runs very well for Amy Jo. They went good and fast and came back to her, but she's a smashing mare and stronger this year - Tim Doyle, trainer

runners.name: Eastern Wind
runners.comment: Maiden hurdle winner last month adding to a Flat success at Bellewstown, definite chance
runners.spotlight: Five-time Flat winner, with latest success over 1m4f on good ground at Bellewstown in April; backed that up a maiden hurdle success at Tipperary, achieved despite some indifferent jumping; in good shape and gets weight from all 17 rivals.

quotes.race: tipperaryraces.ie Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Eastern Wind was getting the hang of it as she went on. She jumped slick over the last couple after being a bit close over the first few. She idled a bit to the line and she'll be a bit of fun during the summer. We'll mix away on the Flat and over hurdles and she goes on any ground - Tom McCourt, trainer.

quotes.race: Sign Up For The Coast To Curragh Charity Cycle August 27th Handicap
quotes.quote: Eastern Wind was very gutsy. James gave her a good ride. She has to be in front and she will battle away if she is - Tom McCourt, trainer.
